comment: A steal. For the price and quality, you get with this purchase you cant go wrong. You get the mount (obviously) a pretty decent HDMI cord and a little level. It was super easy to assemble.The amount of screws and wedges that come with will be a little overwhelming but once you find the right screw you're golden.

I looked at many different wall mounts and was unsure which to buy. Wall mounts for Samsung TV's are a little more challenging because many do not come with compatible bolts. This mount does comes with bolts compatible for a series of different manufacturers including Samsung and the 8000 Series 65in 2018 model. That saved me a trip to the local hardware store. Because the back of the TV is curved I had to fiddle with the brackets to make sure they were snug and secure them with some long spacers that came with the TV and a couple thin spacers that come with the mount. Securing the brackets was the most challenging part but really not that bad. Just take your time and make sure you do it right. Securing the mount to the wall is pretty easy once you get it level. A drill and a socket set and you are good to go. Once it is in a couple studs it is very secure and that TV is not going anywhere. I also paired this mount with the PowerBridge ONE-CK Recessed In-Wall Cable Management System to hide the wires which also works great. Very happy with this mount and would buy again.

This wall mount is extremely strong and able to support my new Samsung 55" flat screen. I was able to screw the mount into two wall studs top and bottom, ensuring this is mounted to the wall safely and w/o any concern of it coming loose. The tilt option and the quick release pull downs are easy to use. The quick release is a great safety assurance that no one is able to accidently lift the bottom of the TV away from the wall. But should you need to do so, each release is quickly accessed by hand and because the TV is a 55" unit, it hides the release pull down ribbons very well. You'll want to use a "real" level and not the 1" bubble level that comes with the wall mount.Installing it was very easy, all (and more) of the screws, washers, connectors came in the package, so no need to have to run out to the hardware store due to missing parts. Instructions were written very well and easy to follow.

I was skeptical when I opened the box but this is a very sturdy mount. It easily handles the weight of my 75" Sony. A couple tips...  it comes in two pieces. When assembling, make sure to push both sides together so they are both lined up a perfectly horizontal. When adjusting the tilt mechanism, you'll want to use something as a gauge so both sides are tilted exactly the same. Mounting the wall mount is easy, but make sure to use a stud finder to locate the center of the studs so the lag bolts can grip securely. There's a little room for vertical play in the mounting slots so you'll be able to fine tune the leveling to some extent. You'll also be able to slide your TV left and right a little to get it centered.BTW, the package include an HDMI cable and a level. I personally wouldn't trust either.

Overall, I would probably honestly get this again.  The price is great, and its well made despite its shortcomings, and comes with good extras (level, HDMI cable). I would not recommend this if your audio/video out plugs are near the bottom of your TV.  Getting the frame on the wall was easy, and so was attacking the braces to the TV.  Everything is very straightforward, instructions are easy, and had plenty of hardware.  The tough parts:1) even using the spacers provided, the TV is "holy crap" close to the wall (to be fair, it is advertised this way).  It seems nice, but the issue is that it doesn't even leave enough room for the plugs.  Power, HDMI, component, they all hit the wall.  This makes tilting the TV difficult if they are on the bottom end of the unit, because they will hit the wall and prevent you from being able to tilt it fully.  It also makes it difficult to lock in the bottom hooks, because you need to jam the TV into the wall and feel like you will break it, and there's a good chance the cords will get in the way.

Very happy with the quality and build of this unit.  Used it to mount my 65 inch TV... feels secure and the straps aren't visible with such a large TV.  I would not recommend relying on the level included with the kit.... mine read off and I had to re-drill and adjust using my quality level... but once up, its up and it ain't coming down.  Funny that brick and mortar stores charge 2 to 3 times the price for a unit like this.  Thank you Mounting Dream, and Thank You Amazon... Hey, remember when you just basically sold books... I do; oh how far we've come.

Admittedly I was skeptical of this mount.  I have two mounts of another more expressive brand that were both installed by a professional.  The other brand cost $150.00 each and supports up 150 lbs.  This significantly cheaper Mounting Dream mount features the same specs and performs just as well.  This mount is very sturdy and offers quick disconnect pull straps to easily remove the TV from the mount if needed.Attaching this mount to the wall was very easy with the aid of the included leveler.  Make sure to find the studs in the wall with a stud finder.  For additional peace of mind, use a magnetic stud finder in addition to the traditional one to locate the nails in the studs.  There is nothing worse than discovering a metal nail in a spot where you need to screw in your last bolt.

I bought this to hang a 37" Vizio TV on the wall. I'm pretty satisfied with it. Lots of flexibility with spacers, holes, and bolts. Seems plenty sturdy for my set.The only slight "gotcha" to be aware of is if you try to set the tilt angle before hanging it on the wall, the latches on the bottom will not engage. It has to be almost completely straight vertical before they will clear the bottom rail and properly lock in place. You can tilt it after its hanging on the wall though. The trick is to tighten the bolts to where they are just tight enough to keep it from moving by itself, but not to tight to prevent movement with a firm pull.

This is a very cheaply made product. If you do buy it purchase your own screws for the tv because now I have a tv with 3 broken off screws in the back of it and can no longer be mounted to the wall.... fyi... one screw broke while attaching it to the tv....and the other 2 broke while trying to take them out of the tv. I got screwed by the screws....

Decent mount for the price. I actually like the simplicity of the packaging. Before I review, I would like to share that if you are intimidated of doing this yourself, don’t be. Acquire a good stud finder, take measurements and order the appropriate mount for your television. This particular mount is for studs 16” apart. This is not always the case in homes. Verify before you buy!!!Pros:

We have a spare 32" TV that's been sitting around and decided to put this in the guest room.  I've installed number of TV's and familiar with proper install including routing the wires behind the dry wall but for this install I opted not to do so.You will either need a stud finder if not a good magnet that has 60 lb pull or more.  IMO the magnet is far more accurate and easy to find studs as often times either you'll see a drywall with ever so slight dimple from the drywall screw.  It'll be either 16" or 24" apart to the center of the stud (goes vertical if you're not familiar with the studs).

Super easy to install and results in an extremely sturdy TV mount. My use case was as easy as it could be with 16" studs but it still would have been pretty easy to get this installed for irregular spacing...they even include instructions with several different options.The TV feels extremely safe and secure and yet it's still super easy to pull the TV down off the wall as well when necessary. The 8 degree downward tilt is perfect as well. I've mounted a TV for a home gym so a slight downward tilt is perfect to accommodate viewing from the floor.

Not the fault of the product, but the wall I needed to mount to is apparently built up as a facade over a structural wall (something I also didn't know) and has 25" stud spacing which the corners of this mount couldn't reach; even for normal walls with 16" studs or "partition" walls with 24" studs, having the wall plate be 30-32" wide would give a lot more flexibility for the installation positioning.I was able to get plenty of strenght using the provided bolts to lag into a stud near the middle along with four heavy-duty drywall toggles at the corners (the toggles alone may have been sufficient, but I don't entirely trust them in that much unsupported drywall.

This is a solid TV mount. We originally bought this big beefy one that had full range of motion for a large tv but decided we did not need all that so we sent back that $200 mount for this much much cheaper one and it does its job great. I was shocked how much lighter and less material there was than the other one but I am fully confident in this mount. We have it above a fire insert in our house holding a 65" Samsung. Bolts it comes with for the tv are great. It comes with a variety of spacers and washers and bolts to ensure it will fit your tv hole depth and the spacers allow you to mix and match to customize the mount fit to your tv. Works well, not worried about that tv at all. Range of motion is low but that is what it is designed to be, it can tilt some but we have it up on the wall so the natural down tilt angle it provides is perfect. We dont ever need to push it flat up against the wall so that is not needed. Given the metal was not wide enough to span three studs, we had to use a thin piece of wood to bolt to the studs and then bolt the mount to the wood but looks good, I trust it, super easy to set up. Once the base is mounted and the backs are on the tv, literally all you do is set it on the mount and it locks in. No more than two people needed, although three would be smart if you have anything bigger than 65". GREAT MOUNT.

As I started assembling the mount I would have given it five stars. I was amazed - five or six different sizes of bolts to attach the bracket to the TV (instead of none like the last one I purchased), each of them with matching washers. About five lengths of spacers (more on this later) to hold the brackets away from the TV. All of the bolts needed to attach the rails to the wall. And the most amazing part of it, each one of them was clearly labeled.It went on the wall easily, and the brackets are easy to hook over the rails. The only thing I could ask would be for the rails to be a couple of inches longer. There is a stud 1/2" away from where the TV should be centered, and once the rails were offset enough to reach the next stud, it was just barely long enough on the other side to reach the bracket.

I ordered this for my 50” Panasonic plasma and it is too small - it is not wide enough for the mounting holes on the tv. The max on the mount is 24” wide and the TV has holes 26” apart.I ordered this figuring that with a 70” maximum, I’d have no issues with my 50” TV. I was wrong!

I used to work as a technician installing home entertainment systems in high end homes, so I have worked on quite a few TV mounts, I also know I didn't need all the bells and whistles, just a basic mount for my living room.The mount arrived and is very straight forward, two brackets on the back of the TV and one plate on the wall. Using the provided lag bolts I was able to install the plate onto the wall with ease, although, WARNING, as you should probably expect, the provided levels IS NOT LEVEL. That isn't really an issue with the mount itself, just a forewarning.

I've professionally mounted a lot of TV's, used a lot of high end mounts.  This is probably the cheapest one.  The mounting hardware was pretty standard, what you get with every mount kit (I have saved all of it just because it's nothing sold in stores so I have spares from my countless installs).The torpedo level was pure junk, but I use a $40 Milwaukee one and other tools of the trade.

Although I prefer one piece mounts to one's that have to be assembled such as these, these worked great to mount 3 flat panel TVs in my new home. Leveling them can be a bit of a chore due to the center connector of the 2 piece mount giving such a short span to reference. You have to be careful when assembling the 2 piece wall bracket to ensure the center support and each side piece are in the same "plane" when referenced from the top. Once that is done though the rest of install is a breeze. I also recommend if only one stud is being used to secure it in other holes using better dry wall anchors than the ones supplied. I got lucky on 2 of the 3 mounts and was able to get it secured to 2 studs. On the third I used large toggle style drywall anchors that engage a large area on the back of the drywall. All in all I am happy with the mounts.

This is the fifth and largest (put up a 75" in the back of our church this time) TV I've put up using a Mounting Dream brand mount, and I am 100% thrilled with the quality and ease of install EACH AND EVERY TIME.  This puppy comes with every type of screw, spacer, and washer you could need. I've mounted 2 Sonys, a Toshiba, and 2 TCLs, and have never needed to buy another piece or part.  This time, I was drilling into concrete so I DID need to buy anchors, but I knew that going in, and wouldn't expect a company to include concrete anchors with every mount when only a very few people would use them.Everything feels strong and secure.  The guy who helped me put this one up (I can handle a 55" and down by myself, but a 75's is too dang big for one dude!) was even impressed with the mount, and then he was REALLY impressed when I told how inexpensive it was.  There is ZERO reason to spend $80-$130 on a mount at the big box stores.  I GUARANTEE YOU they are no better than the Mounting Dream options.

The bracket that mounts on the wall comes in two pieces (only reason for that seems to be so that they can fit it in a smaller box). 4 screws are supposed to attach one half to the other, but they are too big for the holes. Spent 40 minutes trying to figure it out, then unscrewed one of the screws that was already in the bracket (from the factory). It was too big too, but they appear to have hammered it in (threads were bent flat except for the last 2). Replicating that technique didn't really work (they went in, but were loose and fell out), but I put it up anyway. It mostly works, but my tv is now a little crooked on the wall as a result. How this thing got so many good reviews is beyond me.

Wow, amazing product for the price! First thing I was impressed with was how heavy the boxes were! (I ordered 3). The packaging was organized and the instructions were very clear. Great little additions like a template and a level are included. I'm glad I went with this brand because there were way too many options. The review rating made the difference.MEASURE YOUR STUDS BEFORE ORDERING!!

Are you tired of spending $2800 on a wall mount that will give you the same quality as this $27 one? Well look no further and consider the Mounting Dream tv wall mount! Designed for both drywall and concrete installation, with a little bit of patience and planning, this will take your large TV and free up a ton of space versus keeping it on a tv stand.Unboxing? It was a small headache until I actually read the pamphlet. Every item included is categorized together and referenced in the manual for ease of assembling. Give a medal to whoever put this instruction manual together.

I have installed dozens of TV mounts, this the mounting system was easy to put together and easy to install.  The only issue I had was the limited type of screws included.  Other systems which I’ve used have long and short screws of various diameters.  This kit only included one of each diameter which forced me to use several spaces to utilize.  This caused the TV to be farther off the wall than I wanted.  But it still works.  The included HDMI cable is nice but too short to be practical for most installation which put the wires thru the wall.

My wife ordered this for an older (heavier) 70” flat screen. I assumed that it would need to be returned snd a real mount ordered as it was 20% the regular price point for such mounts.  Was I ever wrong.  I am hard to please. I would rather go without than to own junk and modern manufacturing leaves a lot to be desired.  Not this mount.  Heavy gauge metal.  Basically every screw you might need for every major brand individually sealed and labeled?!? Plastic grommets and washers to improve stability depending on style of TV.... also separated and labeled!!??  Instructions were simple and properly labeled with good illustrations!  I cannot believe they did this for under $30.  It is manufactured with a higher quality and better organization that anything I have purchased in a long time. Even came with Lag Bolts to mount into studs instead of undersized screws!  GET IT!!!! You will be impressed.

Mounted a 70" LCD in our workout room so that is at the high end of capacity for this unit. Easy to follow the instructions, kit was complete with all needed screws and spacers, even a HDMI cable and a small bubble level. Easy to hang the TV and holds just fine. The only thing that maybe a negative is the TV tends to lean out from the top a few degrees due to weight and the tilt feature. There may be some way to tighten that, but now that it is up, there is no room behind to poke around and I see nothing on that in the instructions. it's only couple degrees, so no issue for us. I recommend this one for a great value

Needed a product that allowed for an odd spaced studs. This was it. Materials are all metal, with thick stud screws. The attachments for the TV are easy to align and connect to the TV. the only drawback is that I could not adjust the tilt once the TV was place on the wall mount and that the tilt attachments wont lock on to the wall mount if it is pre-tilted. But I have had this on my wall for a month now and sturdy as can be.

My work used Mounting Dream mounts for half a dozen TV's last year and the property staff raved about them. When I needed to wall mount a TV at home I asked them for a recommendation. The weight rating for this mount is over double the weight of my TV, that's about where I like to be  for safety, anything worth doing is worth over doing. The hardest part of the install is locating the studs in the wall. After that it was smooth sailing. The kit includes a small level, once you get one corner bolt started, it's super easy to align the bracket and mark the remaining holes. It's a 2 piece system, the plate is bolted to the wall, the strips are screwed to the TV, lift the TV and hang it on the top of the plate, swing it down and the latches on the strips lock to the plate. There was plenty of various sized screws and spacers to attach the strips to the TV. If you don't need a swivel type mount, this is way to go.

This mount holds our 65” Vizio tv well. The tv is a few years old and heavy. My husband installed it above our fireplace and he said it was easy but he did have go to the store to get anchors since he was mounting it on brick. He, himself, even hung on the wall bracket to see how sturdy it was lol. Very pleased with how easy it was to install and how sturdy it is. Looks great!

If your studs are on 16" centers then this should be fine.  If not, you'll need to buy an adapter kit to mount to the wall and then this will mount to the adapter.  I'm sure it stated that in the fine print on Amazon but I just looked at the weight and TV size it would support.  I happened to be mounting this TV in a bedroom on an interior wall that was shared with a closet and the stud spacing was wider than what this kit would support (I didn't realize that until it was time to mount the TV - which was a surprise Christmas present to my son).  Instead of trying to order the adapter kit, I went ahead and bought a wall mount kit locally that had wider rails and I was able to get it mounted "in time" so everything worked out.  I'm still giving this kit 4 stars because it looks like a good, solid kit and it came with an HDMI cable that I did end up using.  I'm sure I'll use this bracket at some point.

Wall mount simple and good and comes with all screws (M4s/M6s and spacers). The screws to go in the studs of the wall for mounting are 2.5 inches long and could kill Mega-Dracula. Too big for my walls and and could only go in 1.5 inches. Luckily the spacers meant for the M4/M6 mounting screws on the TV brackets can be repurposed to the wall mounting screws and can ensure a snug fit on the wall. See the photos for help with the this off label use and jerry-rigging together. The giant screws stick out still but that is fine and doesn't interfere with the mounting in any way.

RECOMMEND: Use your own level and make sure you have a second set of hands to help put up the TV!I was very concerned about mounting a tv on my wall. I had never done it before and was worried it would fall right out. However, once I saw the mount first-hand those worries went away.
Pros:Very sturdy and well made.

This was great when I first installed it. It was only 5 feet off ground, not much tilt needed. Then I needed to raise the tv highier, turns out this mounting unit does not clip into itself on the highier tilts. The locking mechanism doesn't catch. Piece of crap.

Very simple to install with full instructions and lots of different screw sizes and lengths to suit different TVs. We were mounting a 65" Samsung UHDTV and it needed the longest M8 screws and additional washers and it fitted the highest and lowest holes on the brackets that go on the back of the TV. The spirit level that was included was not used as it was out of level when checked on a flat surface (just swing it through 180 and the bubble was not the same). The holes for the lag screws to hold it to the wall studs needed a 7/32" drill and it still took a hex ratchet wrench and a strong arm to get them fully home. It was a good job that I connected the HDMI cables and the optical cable before mounting on the wall as they are almost inaccessible as the TV is very close to the wall. Two small release straps are provided for the bottom latches but they were just too short to be reached so we extended them by looping string through the straps. It was quite easy to tuck the excess string out of the way so nothing showed. The mounting bracket allows the TV to slide left and right for final positioning which helped as the studs were not in the best position between two large bookcases.Great praise for the well thought out unit and all of the fixings and great instructions.

I bought this to mount my 65 inch Samsung TV and it was a pretty easy installation.I only bought this and a magnetic stud finder (awesome by the way...) and drilled holes into the studs and then drilled the screws in using a socket adapter. Looks great on my wall -- my only complaint is that I don't think the level is that great, it shows it is level but you can tell it is about 1/2 inch off or less, not a big deal... Just have to figure out how to shift a little to make it better! (instructions show how). Also, not that easy to "unscrew" to tilt -- but still a great mount for the price, can't beat it!
Overall, this is a fine TV mount.Pros:
1st star for price2nd stsr for simplicity and wide mounting plate.

Completely changed the TV game. Viewing is so much pleasurable and in a small spaced apartments this is perfect. I wall mounted all my TVs and apartment looks clean and fresh. No nasty dust collecting tv stands with cables hanging all over. 5 min video on YouTube I'm a cable hiding expert. Process was a lot easier with my corded drill compared to battery powered drill. Once I finally figured that out install was a breeze. 1st install took 45 mins. Second and third install took less than 10 mins. Works well with my light weight newer 4K TVs and older model much heavier screen LCD panels. Material quality exceeded expectatios for the asking price. Great value. Wall mounted all my moms apartment TVs. She hated the idea first now can't get enough of how clean and tidy everything is.

After viewing several mounting systems at local stores, I am 100% glad that we chose this one - unseen.  Just physically holding it you can tell it is much better constructed than some more "affordable" mounts in local retail stores.That being said, the instructions were so well detailed, it would be almost impossible to screw this up.  The guide has cut outs to make it easy to level and draw your screw hole placements before you even make a dent in the wall.

Honestly for a long time I didn’t want to mount my TV because I thought it was going to be a real pain. But this mounting kit really does make it super easy. Note: I did this with a 55” TCL 6 series on drywall using the studs as anchors.What you will need: this mounting kit, a drill, a stud finder, YouTube, and half a brain.

I have install quite a few tv mounts now, and i will say this is a great one for the price.  Easy to read instructions, decent hardware and options included.  Nice Hdmi cable included and a very nice low profile mounting solutions that doesn't stick out like half a foot like the mount i used for my living room.  Great for my bedroom setup.  HOWEVER.....I used the level included to install and it was level and after checking several times, keeps saying its level, but it is not, lol...I put the tv on the wall and laid in bed, and my eyes were having a different idea of what was level.  In the morning I checked again, and sure enough the crappy little level it came with says its level.  But I measured from the ceiling to the left and right ends of the tv, and boy it is not, so my eyes see level better then the level does, lol.  I think it is off by atleast a quater inch, which go progressive more out of wack for the 60" tv.  I will have to take the tv down again, which is a pain and loosen the lag bolts and try to see if i can get it more level without having to remount all over again, i might have to go get my 3ft level our of my trunk of my car.  Just a fyi.
Easy to mount but takes know how to do it right:First use mark your studs and find the centers.

This is an extremely well thought out mounting system. The instructions were detailed and clear, and the mounting system came with all kinds of fasteners and spacers for just about any kind of TV model adaptation.  A spirit level is included in the kit, which was a really nice touch!  just the right size for conveniently ensuring that the mount is absolutely level.  The spring loaded bottom clips with pull tabs are a great idea!The instructions stress to ONLY use the lag bolts into wooden studs, or a concrete wall.  They specifically state to NOT use drywall anchors, and I can heartily agree with their warnings.  The lag bolts were very easy to use, and I have had plenty of experience with drywall anchors, both toggle bolts and other kind of in-drywall anchors eventually cutting through or working out of the wall over the years and dumping stuff on the floor.  Vibrations in the house eventually degrade just about any drywall anchor connection that is under significant static load.

Like the title says, you get a lot more from this mount than what you pay for.Installation was actually pretty easy. You'll need a stud finder, a 5/32" drill bit, a drill, a pencil, tape measure, and a 1/2" ratchet (at least to make it easy you will). I used a drill to get the mounting bolts in about 2/3 of the way and then had to use the ratchet to get them in. If you have a large screwdriver it can be done, but a ratchet is highly recommended. Comes with a small level that's actually pretty useful. Took me about 10 minutes to install. Also, just an FYI, the smaller model does not come with an HDMI cable, although I'm fine with that because I had several extras laying around.

The instructions advise that if you are spanning three studs (standard 16" on center), you should attach the wall bracket to all three studs using six screws.  However there is no center hole on the bracket to use to attach to the center stud.  And the span of the farthest holes is 32" so there is no latitude to move the bracket slightly left or right to align a hole with the center stud.  I thought  attaching the wall bracket to just the two outer studs (32" apart) would be sufficient.  However, the wall bracket bows away from the wall under the weight of the TV in the center.  ( My television weighs 45 lbs. and the maximum weight specified for the wall bracket is 132 ibs.)  I will need to drill a hole through the metal bracket to attach it to the wall at the center stud.

Alright so i waited a couple days to post a review. What i like about this product is that it does it what it says(mounts your tv :) ). It is quite sturdy and not at all complicated to put together. It comes with instructions and a small leveling tool. I would recommend you get this for the recommended tv sizes each version can hold. It does have a slight tilt forward i believe a few degrees forward. The tilt is decent enough depending on how far the tv is from the bed and how far up you place your tv. If its above your eye level then you might want another product depending on how big your tv is. If its just at eye level and below then you should be good.This took me about 1 1/2 hours because i wanted to make sure it was even and that it was going to be secure. Also it took me awhile to figure out how to operate the hand drill properly before i could get things to go smooth.  The 4th picture is all the tools i used to mount my tv.

Bought this to mount 50” TV in our living room. The mount is great, no complaints there. The straps at the bottom that are used to release the mounting arms from the mount on the wall are a little long, but we easily cut them to size so they didn’t hang below TV. Only reason I give this 3 stars is because the level that was included with this mount was total garbage. I didn’t check it before I mounted to wall and TV was not level by 1/4”. I went to my garage, got my own level and remounted the mount to the wall, everything was fine then. I even took the included level and put it on our mantel (which was of course level) and it showed that our mantel was not level. Be sure to use your own level if you buy this mount!
Pros:- This is a great, sturdy product and their support is 100% fantastic. Just give yourself some time depending on your method.

I have worked in the audio/video business and have had extensive experience with mounting brackets, so I was skeptical about the quality of a bracket at this price point. Upon receiving this bracket, I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and design, and that they included everything needed to install the bracket (except tools of course). The provided level  and HDMI cable were an added plus. Installation was easy and seamless our new 50" mounted up with no problems. Other reviews have mentioned that the screws used to attach the two sides of the mounting plate together were too big for the threaded holes. This is due to paint in the threads of the plate. Once you get the screws started they go in no problem.The only complaint I have is that it is nearly impossible to tighten the set screws holing the TV at an angle due to how close the TV is to the wall.

Easy to install, cheap priced especially during the holiday season. The included level is cute, but use a bigger one. The longest part is the trial and error and figuring out what works best for you and your wall. A week later I had to adjust my tv with bigger spacers for better tilting. I tilted the tv about 4 degrees or half way and it feels stable. Only flaw is, like what others have said, that there should be a center drilled hole from the factory especially for 16 inch studs. But with that said I feel comfortable using only four screws as it supported my weight (265 lbs) and my LG weighs 50 lbs but YMMV. Overall, a good mount. I am glad I did not spend more on mounts from other stores.

I have never installed a tv on a wall before & I was flying solo on this project so I could surprise my husband. The bracket was perfect for my needs. Simple design with multiple mounting holes, allowing me versatility in how I secured it.- TV size is 65"

Good straightforward mount that works as you would expect. The wall plate comes in two pieces and you screw the right side rails to the center bracket. This could be a problem for some. The release pulls are adjustable in length to help hide them behind smaller tv’s. I am using this in a rental unit and found it to be quality substantial enough for light commercial action.Works great for a flush mount on a very thin led backlit 55” tv.
+1 - Item arrived on time, and not damaged+1 - Item is as described

So I have installed many and I mean many different types of TV wall mounts.  These are the best and easiest TV mounts that I have installed.  I have now installed 14 of these mounts.  I like that they are thin and keep the TV close to the wall.  They allow plenty of tilt in the TV.  They came with everything needed to install (including a cute little magnetic level) :).  I don't use them but at least they come with it.  I now have a bucket of these little levels if anyone needs one.  So far, It has come with every bolt/bushing needed for every TV VESA setup I have used.  I have used this mount for Sony, Samsung, Vizio, LG, TCL, Hisense, and yes even an Insignia.  Sizes from 40 to 75 inches (Yes, I said 75").  I don't know why the 70" limit.  The LG 75" fits great on them.  So far they have spread across all stud setups.  Haven't had a need to use a molly yet because there are so many mounting holes on the base.  If I have one complaint to be nit picky... the straps on the tv vesa mounts for the latches are too long.  In order to hide them after mounting a TV, you need to tie them up.  Forget using the adjusting slide, it doesnt get them short enough. Before mounting the TV I have learned to use a wire tie to hold them up and then put TV on wall.  I can mount a TV now in about 15-20 minutes with these mounts.  But of course I've done few now.  I would give yourself about 40-45 minutes first time.I am very confident that anyone can mount a TV with this mount.  Its that simple.  2 Screws to assemble the back plate.  4 lags to mount plate to wall.  4 bolts for TV VESA.  Lift it up and put it on the bracket.  Push slightly on bottom of tv till you here it click in place.  Than you can slide it on the mount right or left to tweak it where you want.  Done.

The very first things that impressed me  on this TV mount was the price and the ultra fast delivery. But, seeing the product was a real wow!For our TV wall installation, I wanted to make certain that wall mount would include 24" on centers mounting-and it does. When opening the box, it was determined that was well made. It was also very simple to put together and mount to the wall.

I wanted to center the TV in the wall. In my case there was a stud right in the center and the next ones 16" in each directions. That seems ideal but really isn't. I have a 46" TV. If I wanted to hit two studs, I would have had to hit the center stud and another one to the left or right of it. This could have almost worked IF the mount had been a lot wider or wasn't split and screwed together via that middle plate. The 8" spacing of the hangers combined with the amount of space the middle plate takes up makes it impossible to position the TV properly. If the back had been one solid piece, I could have slid the TV along the mount until it was centered. Luckily I found another mount at MonoPrice that is 33.8" wide (one piece) that will reach from the left stud to the right stud and should hold my 46" TV as well as hopefully a future 70".

Great item!  Installed myself with no problems.  I will add that I have never installed a tv wall mount before.  I did watch a couple youtube videos first.  Came with enough bolts and washers to get just the right fit for my tv.  Cannot believe how affordable it is, and very sturdy.  Will come back here for my future needs.  Bought it for my craft room to watch Netflix and Youtube videos.  I installed a TCL Roku tv, and loaded enough apps that I can watch live tv (via the various network apps), and didn't need to get another box from my Satellite provider.I also purchased this item:https://www.amazon.com/dp/B00H8BXIE4/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_10, to provide a longer cord for my wall mounted tv.  Next step is to drop the wires behind the wall.  You can't beat the availability of necessary items on Amazon.  Saved me tons of money purchasing here.  And, I would say this is equal to any other retail items.

This here TV mount was perfect to hang my new 65 inch TV over the fireplace.  I figured I’d get me one of those bigger screen TVs so I wouldn’t have to squint to see what was playin, and man oh man, it looks awesome. Anyway, this mount was super easy to install. It even came with a small magnetic level to help get it right! My wife was very impressed that I got it hung up straight the first time and didn’t have to use a hammer to “adjust it” anywhere. Very simple instructions that were easy to ignore, since it’s a pretty straightforward installation. Don’t get me wrong, I looked at the instructions every time my wife walked in to check on me, but promptly dropped em when she walked out.  Ya’ll don’t rat me out now.  She thinks I followed them instructions to a tee!! Heck, a quick glance at the picture on the box was enough to figure this thing out. The TV is hanging up there right nice and has been for a good month or so. My wife has commented on how well it looks several times, so I guess I’ll give this mount a good thumbs up.

It held up my moms 50" LG TV with no problems. I will admit it was a little bit smaller than I expected, but the only reason why I think it is small is due to the long large one I bought years ago that is nearly double the size. Since it is not that ling, you have less frame to work with to center on your walls. Because you have to screw these wall mounts on the studs. With that said, I was able to mount it up with all kinds of screws and little level it came with. It also came with an HDMI cable as a bonus I guess, you can always use extra hdmi cables!Her TV has been mounted for 4+ months now and holding strong. I think it's a good cheap rout to have.
I used it for a 65” Samsung. I’m a mechanical engineer.If tilted the bottom of the TV touches the wall, and you can’t get a hand in to reach the release straps.

Used this to wall mount my 58” plasma TV. Installed in about 30 minutes including attaching brackets & spacers to tv & wall. If you have a large TV with VESA mounting holes this is a great product at a fantastic price. Only tools I needed was a drill & drill bit. It comes with a tiny bubble level, but I used a 4’ level for increased precision to level the wall mount.

You get what you pay for. In the case of this particular TV mount, that stands true. For the low price, don't expect something of great quality, because you won't get it. If you go in with the mind set that this mount is fairly inexpensive, then you will be happy in the end. If you have a TV that is relatively light, then this mount is truly all you need. While it claims to support 100+ lbs, I am not sure I would test that theory.The mount itself comes in two pieces which is part of why I removed one star from the rating. This causes it to be be true and bend slightly. It can also cause it to twist which leads to your TV not being level. It also comes with a 50 cents level to help. You can never fault a company for providing extra items, no matter the quality however I would of liked to see the bubbles in the stand itself.

This mount is easy to install however the back wall mount plate should be wider to span three studs on 16" centers.  The design does work for two studs BUT the anchor bolts will not be at the ends of the bracket.  If you set bolts on one end on stud the other end will be much further in from the other side.  That said, you can hang anything from this bracket once installed.  The hardware is very complete and included various spacers to position the TV further from the wall if it is required for cable hook up.  The latching system is all metal and appears to be very well made and strong.  It took about 30 minuets to settle wall plate  including locating stud centers both with stud finder and small pilot drill bit.  The anchor bolts are substantial and this hanger should support the weight as advertised.  I am hanging a 55" TCL to the wall and it certainly will be more the adequate.  The tilt function is easy to set and adjust just tighten the bolts to achieve the proper tension and the angle is easily adjusted.  All hardware  except the spacers is metal and the packaging of the hardware is exceptional in terms of each group of items are individually sealed and marked so that it is easy to identify.

We have had a few different versions of TV mounting brackets and this one is the easiest we have installed! We have 5 TV in the home, and recently added this one for our 70in TV. We like it because it's simple to install, the mounting hardware is easy to screw in and will work with standard 16in studs. Once the brackets are installed to TV and wall, its super simple to mount. You just hang the TV from the top portion of the bracket and then pull the cord to lock in the bottom.  Since mounting, we have moved the TV off that wall about 4 or 5 times quickly and easily to paint or add shelving - each time it was effortless to reinstall. There is also just enough space on the back of the TV to see where to plug in everything - but I do advise plugging in all devices and connectors TO THE TV first if you can before mounting - then attach them to the cable box/surround sound or other devices after you hang the TV.

It’s a pretty good mount I’m a fan of mounting dream mounts. This one is the worst I’ve used from the brand. It’s on piece, well built, and sturdy as usual. Less hardware is included in the box. I’m assuming it’s because it’s meant for bigger televisions. It was tough to find bolts that fit the 70” LG T.V I installed. I ended up having to use two spacers along with the longest bolt. The biggest and most infuriating disappointment is that this mount has a tilt feature 8 degrees which is pathetic. Tilting it at its max causes the hooks to narrow to much for it to latch. Rendering the security latches useless. Obviously this is a products with a design flaw that nobody seems to have bothered to test.

This is the second Mounting Dream TV mount we have purchased from Amazon. The first one was for our patio outside and was an articulating mount. It was so strong and well built I decided to pay a little more for a simple tilting wall mount for our bedroom.  They provide several types of VESA bolts to fit many different TV mounting holes. They also provide spacers, washers and lag bolts. Since I was attaching a 50" Plasma weighing about 75 lbs on a metal studded wall I bought 6 snap wall toggle anchors as was recommended on a YouTube about mounting on a metal studded wall. The ones I got were from Home Depot and 4 of the six broke while inserting into the drilled hole. Fortunately I have standard 3/16" toggle bolts. While harder to install they worked much better and more secure so if going into metal studs I recommend standard toggle bolts. Be sure to find the center of the stud by using a magnet and nailing on both sides of the studs to find the center. Back to the mount; it is really well designed and strong. You can adjust it many different ways which is a must due to spacing of the studs which is usually 16" apart. You will love this mount.

Mount sits on the wall OK, but the attachment points at the back are trash, so once its attached to the wall I hope you dont have anything else to plug in.  The little cables that are supposed to pull the clamps down will also break, since, you know, the clamp wont move.  I'm giving it 4 stars for sturdy because it seems ok, but I could screw a piece of plywood to my wall and that would probably be sturdy, too.  Probably roughly as functional, too.

Pretty simple and straightforward installation, though a couple tips for novices like me.They don’t spell it out, but the awl in the instructions is to poke in the wall and make sure you’re going into a stud before you drill big holes.  If you don’t have an awl you can do the same thing by hammering a small nail into the wall. The smaller nail the better. If the nail goes in and comes out very easily (i.e. you can do it with your fingers), it’s not in the stud. Invest in a decent stud finder, better models will indicate the middle.

I wanted the wall-mount my TV to reclaim some space in my cabin. This wall mount did the trick, but I feel the need to point out some issues that I encountered during setup.First off, the ease of installation depends on your TV. I have a Samsung KS8000, and no combination of the included mounting spacers would work for me. (Honestly, in that respect, this kit feels a little thrown together.) That said, I've mounted my TV to a floor stand before, so I thankfully already had the mounting hardware that I needed for the portion of the mount that attaches to the back of the TV.

I purchased two of these mounts, one in May of 2017 and one in November of 2018. I was very satisfied with the May 2017 mount and decided to purchase and additional. The two mounts looked cosmetically similar (plate, hooks, and pull cord that locks in TV), but unfortunately the manufacturer has decided to reduce the quality of the good considerably over those 18 months. I cannot recommend this product due to this disappointing change.

I was originally worried that I would not be able to do this by myself. I purchased a stud finder, and it also showed me the width of the studs, and used a tape measure to measure between the studs. To my surprise there was a typical distance between two of the studs, but it seemed like I was missing a stud to the left of that! That narrowed my options on where to mount this dramatically. I was able to compinsate for this by just sliding the tv on the mount to the left and it centered it where I wanted it.The instructions call for a socket wrench, and i would HIGHLY recommend this. I tried with a screw driver and it was not able to apply the require amount of torque needed to tighten the screws on to the studs. I am very happy with this purchase and the included magnetic level was a nice touch.

I bought this to mount my 65 inch TCL TV.  It shipped fast and was packaged well.  The mount itself is well built with decent gauged metal.  It comes with a bunch of hardware (lags, bolts, nuts, washers, level, spacers, etc.). I put this on my cement block basement wall.  It does not have anchors for concrete or block, apparently you need to request them separately.  It may have been advertised when I was purchasing this, but I did not see that.  I have a bunch of anchors, so it wasn't a big deal.  It does come with a bracket stencil, so it's pretty easy to plan where to put the holes in the wall.  I used six 3/8-inch anchors and two 1/2-inch anchors to mount the bracket (a bit of overkill).  There are two vertical braces that get bolted to the back of the TV.  It was pretty easy to complete.  It seems more that strong enough for my TV.  It's well priced, comes with lots of hardware, and works.  I'm happy.

Very solid bracket. I used this to mount my 55inch Samsung Curved 4K TVCame with all the included spacers and Allen key needed to adjust the tilt. All you need is a Philips head screwdriver and a 13mm ratchet to install this wall mount.

This mount was very easy to install. You’ll need a stud finder to ensure it is mounted properly, which you can find for around $10. I got the entire put together solo, and just needed an assist from my wife when we actually put in the tv. It was easy enough that I bought a second one for another room.

Overall, it seems like a solid tv mount! It did take us a while to install it, and I would not call doing so easy. We also have to reinstall it because somehow, even with the level (which is awesome that they include, the tv ended up being crooked on the wall. I am not sure if that means our ceiling is not straight? It would be great if it had a bit more range of motion so we could adjust the angle a bit instead of having to reinstall it. Some positives is that it does give detailed instructions and different options of screws and washers to go with your tv. These items are also packaged in an organized manner. I recommend this for people who are good at installing tv mounts, or at least better than my husband and I are at it!

This is a very solid and impressively designed wall mount and I can highly recommend it. I originally bought a wall mount from Best Buy that I was ultimately unable to make work because it did not have the right bolts and adapters to fit the back of my new TV.After researching a number of wall mounts, I chose this one and couldn’t be more pleased. It’s sturdy, well designed, easy to install on the wall. And it came with all the possible bolts and adapters that you need for various TVs. The instructions also were clear and easy to follow. One person can easily install this by themselves although it does take two people to hang the TV on to it.

Yes, I have installed this TV mounting wall unit in my motorhome (replaced the old style TV with a new lightweight digital unit). There was really nothing major in installing this mounting unit. The instructions are easy to follow, and there was a large variety of screws, bushings, washers, etc. to perform the installation. I am very satisfied with the packaging, instructions, and ease of installing this product. I cannot think of a thing that could be changed, especially for the price I paid for the Mounting Dream MD2268-MK Wall Mount Tilting Unit. One thing that I would suggest for anyone installing the mounting unit in an RV, such as I have, is to install a stop to keep the TV from sliding side to side, when the RV is in motion. I accomplished this simply by installing a drywall screw to the side of the vertical brackets (that attach to the TV) on the horizontal bracket that attaches to the wall, or mounting surface.

Overall this is exactly what you'd expect from a mounting system. It does exactly what you need to to, it's compact, it's easy to install, and it holds a tv.  My complaint is that it's not wide enough. Its a little more than 2 studs wide. Which sounds great. But when you have a stud in the middle of your wall - it's not. Your forced to hang the mount to the "left" and then slide the TV all the way to the right. - The TV looks centered on the wall.That might be fine for a small or cheap TV. If it was just another 2" wider on each side it would be so much easier to hang where you want. I bought 4 of these but after mounting 2, I'm looking at other solutions and returning the others.

This seems to be of good quality, but the design is terrible.  There is a big dead space in the middle where you join the 2 wall mounts together to make one.  It takes out about 4" out of adjustment space.  Doesn't sound like much, but when you are working around a plug...which presumably you are...it makes it extremely difficult to center on the wall, and get the lag bolts into a stud.  I just ended up having to go to Lowes and buy one that is a solid piece, so I have full range of adjustment.  Hopefully I can return this...

Pros: sturdy, small form factor, tilts as advertised, priceCons: the screws were too short, there are loops of webbing dangling down below the bottom edge of the TV, and to adjust the tilt requires an Allen wrench and a very, very slender arm.

Product was simple to install and accounted for almost all the needs of my Samsung 65" TV.  The only issue is that the bolts for mounting brackets to the back of the TV were not long enough to allow use of any of the spacers on the bottom holes.  The bottom threads are set quite deep into the TV and I will have to invest in some longer bolts once this coronavirus stuff settles down.

Got this to wall mount my 65in Samsung 7100 (400 x 400 VESA). All screws were included which was great, because I didn’t have any wall mounting accessories with the TV. It looked like screws for most tv types were included in the box. Mounting was easy, even though I’m not very handy. The only problem after mounting is that you can’t plug or remove cables into the tv (atleast in my model).  Also, you need to tighten the hinges before mounting, else the tv will tilt down. It does not articulate down as much as I expected. I now feel I should have gone for a mount that allows the tv to be pulled in and out in addition to being articulated at different angles. That would have better addressed outside light glare issues I have in my living room. Still, it looks sturdy and allows the tv to be placed very close to the wall. For the money, this is a great buy.

This bracket was fine for my 65" LG TV. Went together easy, has clear instructions and is pretty flexible. Enabled me to pivot my TV down toward the viewing area. The only complaint I have is that once hung, there is almost no room to make connections behind the TV, and the bottom clips don't grab with a lot of force, so when I was wriggling my hand back there to get things connected, the bottom clips popped loose and the TV was just swinging from the top brackets. It was a bit nerve-wracking but the TV never fell. I think this would be a 5 star bracket if the bottom clips were stronger or it had a little more room to swing out at the bottom to make connections.

My husband and I installed this in our bedroom. It is holding a 55 inch TV. It was very easy to install. It obviously took 2 of us because of the size. I only held pieces while he drilled to make it easier to keep it level.I also helped put the TV on the mount.

This afternoon, I installed two of these mounting dream  TV mounts.  I have never done this before, but the instructions are very easy, every piece of hardware is labeled in a very organized way, and it even comes with a little level.  I was able to assemble the mounts and get them up on the wall in about 30 minutes (each).  In the future, I will be looking for the full motion mount for another TV and will definitely be purchasing it from Mounting Dream.

Our feedback to our builder is that the electrician seemed to be trying to make it impossible to mount a TV in any spot. They did 22" gaps between the studs and placed the behind TV mount electrical and wire tubes at the exact wrong spots to work with any TV mount, as well as making it impossible to center a TV. So we went to look for a wider TV mount and this was the only one we could find. Thankfully, it worked out perfectly in the two troublesome spots!This is also the thinnest TV mount I've seen. Our TV is hanging less than inch off the wall, which looks phenomenal.

We initially set the TV brackets too low and the TV ended up sitting too high! Adjusted them to the lowest VESA screw hole, and the TV ended up mounting right about where we wanted it. The wall bracket is a little over 25" in length, which is exactly what I needed to mount it to the studs. We took it down again to add the spacers (a bonus) so the surge protector could be hidden behind the wall and accommodate certain plugs. The setup overall was easy. I did add extra drywall anchors because I'm leery about hanging any TV to a wall, but this one, according to its specs, is 30 pounds, so I'm not worried about it falling down.

I gotta say, this was fairly easy and painless when it came to actually installing the bracket. I think I spent more time looking for the studs than what it took to drill and mount the bracket. They really made it simple and easy, and there's videos on You Tube on how to do it if you're more of a visual person. I would say the only downside is that the  range of motion isn't much. Once you mount the TV, you can tilt it downward a bit, but that's it. You can't turn it left or right and it won't extend outward either. I'm OK with it, but other folks might be looking for more. Keep that in mind when purchasing this item.

My 64 year old husband with a little help from his brother installed this wall mount up for our 55" Hiscense tv that took them about 30 minutes. I noticed a few parts left in the box but I guess they weren't needed because the tv is still on the wall!! The tv was on a stand in a smaller room so we were able to get that out of the way so besides a great tv mount at an exceptional lightening deal price we now have more room. It also came with a HDMI cord that my daughter was going to have to buy so she could hook her iPhone up to the tv so that was an added bonus! Very pleased with this purchase.

I have bought around 10 of these now (for an office) and they are fantastic. They are extremely easy to install and level and very sturdy. I love how close they get the TV to the wall. This particular model is of course not as moveable as some others but that's really where it shines. Because it doesn't have all the extra motion, the TV can hug right against the wall.

This is a great wall mount. My dad installed it for me super quickly and it does it’s job! The only thing is keeping the release tabs hidden from view, it’s a little hard to do and that might just be because of the TV I have. But I have released the TV on my own and it is super easy to do! One thing to keep in mind before purchasing is do you want your TV to come off of the wall? This amount does not do that and I wish I had researched a little bit more before purchasing. When I wanted to plug-in a gaming system and take out the DVD player from behind the TV, I had to release the whole TVBecause amount does not allow you to move the TV forward. It’s not the worst thing in the world if you’re not switching or unplugging things behind your TV, but it is something to keep in mind!

I purchased 2 of these to mount a 55" Samsung & a 65" Sony. This was my first time mounting TV's to the wall and I was very impressed with this mount. It's well made and is easy to install.Tools needed: Drill (7/32" bit), Philips's head Screwdriver, 1/2" or 13mm Socket Wrench

I like that this product is simple, solid, does it job well, and it comes with many extra items to make installation easier.  It is well designed, and you can tell they put a lot of thought into the product.  It comes with many screws, spacers and washers in different sizes to accommodate for any size TV or wall type.  It comes with easy to assemble instructions and is efficiently packed in a compact box.  It even includes a free velcro tie-wrap, a brand new HDMI cable and a leveling tool to ensure that the installation is balanced.  I installed my TV on the wall in less than 30 minutes, and it looks great.  If I could give it six stars I would, it's that good a deal.

Perfect fit between 16” Studs. Bracket is only 16” wide so you will have to mount using last hole on all corners of bracket. No problem for me as studs are 16” apart. Bracket and bolts are plenty strong for large TV. I don’t know why anyone would pay more than $20 or $30 for a different brand. Small level fits on frame which makes it easy to install exactly level. I suggest you buy the next size up in width to give you a little more flexibility in moving TV left to right.

Typical unboxing, dump it out on the bed.  As I decide to go get my level I look down and find that, it comes with one!  No kidding.  There is a 6 inch or so level in the kit.  I was impressed.  It also comes with every size bolt you could ask for, wall anchors and an HDMI cable.  Looking at the picture I see that there is a level, but I guess I over looked that part, but was happy to find it.  Price is right too.

This is a great bracket. Easy to install (if you are mounting into studs 16" apart). Tilt works nicely once you tighten it a bit. Has about 30 different screws, washers, etc so you should be covered.I like these types of brackets because they have a tight spacing between the wall and tv. If you haven't noticed, newer tvs are getting thicker and thicker every year. Many are 4-5" thick. Add your mount and that tv can stick out quite a bit. Swivel mounts are 3-4" which could put your TV 9" from the wall. That just looks silly . This type is much less and gives a nicer flush fit.

If you are purchasing a new TV this kit would be the perfect hanging solution.There are probably others that fit the bill but this one includes all the hardware I would have needed to hang mine and save trips to the hardware store, including lags for wood framing scenario.

I always purchased my TV Mounts on Amazon but was looking for one over the weekend at different stores like Target, Home Depot, and other similar places. I could not believe how much those stores were charging for an inferior product. At the stores you would have to pay around $80-100 dollars just for a regular non tilt mount that did not include any HDMI cable or anything else. So I purchased this mount for more much much cheaper and it is exactly what I was hoping. A sturdy, easy to install, well built mount that fit right onto my TV. Purchasing a wall mount in a brick and mortar store is literally out of the question.

This certainly gets the job done. I bought it first and installed my 65” TV upstairs. Loved the look, so I wanted to install a TV downstairs on the wall as well. I purchased the second mount from Walmart, the brand was ONN. It cost me $10 less and has a better range of motion, and better straps to remove the TV from the mount. Overall, if I had to do it again I would have bought two ONN mounts and skipped this one.

Used this to mount my 2016 Vizio P-65 C1 on the wall. Wanted a relatively flush mount that wouldn't break the bank.Overall, the metal plate and screws are all quality at or above the price range. My only issue was that the lag bolts to attach the wall plate are very easy to strip.  Luckily, the bolts are also hexed off on the edges so I was able to use a pair of locking pliers to (slowly) turn the bolts tight. I would suggest just doing this instead of risking stripping the heads like I did.

This TV wall mount was easy to install.  Itis very sturdy for our 65" TV. I would buy it again if I had another tv. Two things:1) I gave 5 star for range of motion only because there was no N/A option. This is only a tilting mount.

I, for whatever reason, thought this could turn and tilt at every angle, but it doesn't. It only goes up and down. Which is fine, but it would have been nice to angle it to the right for us.I'm not taking that really into consideration with my star rating though, because that was my fault for not looking into this more.

Really easy and nice setup, they give multiple sets of screws and spacers tips fit most TVs, and they had the perfect spacer for my TCL TV! Super sturdy and is nice that you can tilt it down or have it flat against the wall!Easy to pop the tv on and off as well the the safety latches

I have never mounted a TV before so I was a little unsure on the best mount to buy considering all the options out there. I saw that this one was way more affordable than others and had a lot of positive feedback so I took a chance and got one. I am very happy that I went with this wall mount for our 50 inch TCL. The rails on the back fit nice and tightly, and the process of mounting went smoothly for the most part. I did find the screws to be a little frail when pushing them in with a power drill, so I had to use a wrench to crank it the rest of the way.Aside from a few technical issues with setting up the plate, the process was very easy and securely holds my TV in place. The bonus HDMI and level were not totally necessary, but very welcomed.

I saw this supported "Most TVs" 37-70 inches, and assumed my older 65 inch Panasonic VIera Plasma would fit. Mainstream brand, less than 70 inches, should be fine, right? WRONG. The mount wouldn't support the larger horizontal space between the brackets.I didn't realize what VESA was until later. Measure the horizontal and vertical space between the mount points first before buying. I was dumb but wish documentation here was a bit better.

Everything is packaged in a surprisingly small box, organized into clearly-labeled packages and detailed with thorough instructions. The pull cords make TV removal and adjustment easy. The included level appeared accurate compared to my normal level (I never trust cheap included ones) and the free HDMI cable was a nice bonus.Everything is metal, although there was a slight bow at the center (the unit is two pairs of rails, joined in the center vertical plate), which I had to accommodate when mounting.

Overall a great kit, mount is solid once assembled, and a plethora of fasteners and adapters are included for just about any mounting format on your flat screen TV.  That being said, the central metal plate separating the left and right sides of the mount, while a nice place to put a logo, creates a limit to how far left or right you can slide your TV on the mount.  This becomes an issue if, as in my case, the studs in the wall don't allow you to center the mount within a limited space in which you desire to place your TV say within a shelving system that has a TV-shaped opening.  In my example that meant I had to locate the mounting plate several inches right of center.  If that center plate wasn't there, I could've slid the TV further to the left to get it centered, but  the plate acted as a hard stop to that.  If you're like me, and need to mount you TV in a designated space, and your studs don't cooperate I would recommend purchasing the MD mount that doesn't have the plate:  https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07HFSBY8S/ref=oh_aui_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1It's dimensionally identical to this mount, but comes in one piece eliminating the stop plate.  It's an all round better choice with better verstility.

This mounts easily and feels pretty sturdy once up, but make sure to locate your 2 studs before buying. If your tv is not going to align perfectly center with the mount based on where the studs are located, you will need to get the larger length mount size. We decided not to exchange as we were anxious to get the tv on the wall, so used 1x3 wood to attach to both studs, then attached the tv mount to the wood. It causes the tv to stick out almost an inch more, which is ok for us but may not be okay for everyone. See photos.

I've been buying thru Amazon since 2003 ( yes, I wish I had bought the stock back then ) . After years and hundreds of items, I can tell you that this is of the best products I 've ever bought. Lower cost than Walmart, Costco , etc., but no lower quality . It delivers what you need at a much lower price . The manufacturer also includes a small level and a HDMI cable with the package . I hung a 65 inches LG LED Tv with it. The whole process of installation took me about 15-20 minutes. Great buy , you cant go wrong.

I found this TV mount well made and easy to assemble.  It had everything I needed for installation (including easy to understand directions and tons of washers, screws and spacer options).  The mount itself has a nice power coat finish.  It is quick and easy to assemble.  The kit comes with various screw sizes, spacers and washers to mount the arm brackets to your TV.  I had no trouble attaching it to my 43" Vizio.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU USE YOUR OWN TRUSTED LEVEL!  The small levels that come with these kits are not reliable.The most time consuming part of the whole process was marking my measurements and finding the studs.  4 sturdy lag bolts were included to mount the bracket.  Once mounted, the TV is easily attached and locked on with the pull straps.  Some folks don't like that the straps hang down.  You can tape them up if its a big deal but they are way easier to use than the alternative allen screw style.  It takes mere seconds to hang or remove the TV.  This mount is very adjustable. Besides tilt angle, you can also slide the TV left or right a few inches and you can remount the arm hangers up or down for height too.  Another plus is I get to use all the leftover hardware for future home projects.

I installed this mount on my wall last night for a newly purchased 70" LG TV, and it was incredibly easy to assemble/install.  I was very meticulous with my measurements, which took up the most of my time during installation, but the actual process of assembling the bracket and mounting it to the wall took a whole 30 min tops. After installing the wall bracket with the provided lag bolts, that thing wasn't going anywhere.  My TV weights approximately 67 pounds, and I'm incredibly confident that this bracket will hold it with no problem whatsoever.For anyone trying to dial in exactly how high to install the mount on the wall, there is a very easy process that I used that worked like a charm.  Simply attack the mounting arms to the back of the TV, click the wall bracket into place on the arms, then measure the distance from the bottom of the bracket to the bottom of the TV.  Then, simply add the desired height you want from the floor/mantle/etc. to that measurement, and you're done.  Take this overall height measurement, draw a line on the wall at that height, then mount the wall bracket where the bottom of the bracket rests on that line.  This method worked out perfectly for me.

Ordered two of these to mount a couple of older flat screens (42 inch LG and a 42 inch Panasonic). Both of them seemed very consistently machined, but there is enough play in the slots to adjust a little bit to make up for any small differences. Once the plate was bolted to the wall the rest snapped together very easily. My only gripes about it are the adjustment for the tilt on the mount. This needs to be done without the tv being on the wall (which means if you dont like the angle you need to take the tv back off of the plate on the wall). The other issue it that there aren't any marks on the adjustment slot so it can be tricky to get both sides the same since there are two adjustments that are independent of each other. These are minor issues especially considering the price. The mount also comes with an HDMI cable and a small level. Some people that reviewed said that they wouldn't trust them. I compared the included level with my normal one and it's definitely a cheap level but did its job well enough, I used it while mounting mine up just to see and got a good result. The HDMI cable is braided and looks nice but I cant speak to the quality of it. Overall for the price I would definitely reccomend it if you only need left to right and tilt adjustments

The part that mounts into the wall is fine but the two parts that click into the mount are cheap plastic, I actually broke my brand new $3000 TV while installing onto the wall and this cheap mount was likely the cause from trying to get the TV to click into the mount, which couldn’t bc the one plastic part was broken on the right side

I had a bulky lip around a recessed outlet that was in the way of my rack laying flush on my wall. I was able to use the supplied small spacers behind the 4 lag bolts to push the frame off about 1/4 inch or less off that wall to allow my frame to lay even.That’s a clunky issue I had, but due to fixing that. I also resolved an issue another buyer mentioned. Which was that if you go full tilt, the bottom backet on the tv won’t clip onto the of the bottom rack. However, with the spacers this problem was solved and the tv can now tilt without:  1. Hitting the wall at the bottom 2. Fully lock at the bottom of the rack, in addition to the top.
Seller claims will fit 24" stud spacing but the product is only 17" wide, making it impossible for the mount to fit a 24" stud spacing. Extremely disappointed that my time was wasted.

Great price. Simple install in under 30 minutes. Mounted a 32" Samsung LED 1080p HD TV (which is very lightweight). I wanted a mount snug to the wall yet with good access to cables (HDMI, network, power...). It's super simple to attach. Instead of a "VESA" mount, you simply align the two vertical mounts and secure to the TV. The Mounting Dream kit came with ample size & length screws, spacers, etc. I did not use the anchors they provided. I prefer self-starting drywall anchors. Used 4, 75lb rated anchors (over engineered :-))  The only 1 design improvement I'd wish is that the latch / unlatch straps at the bottom had an easy way to retract them out of sight. Since it's close to the wall, it's a bit of a challenge to hide them or zip-tie them out of sight. But hey, for the price, no complaints.

First, this is a nice mount at a reasonable price. However, I took off 2 stars for the additional 2 holes that must be drilled right in the middle of the mount (through the Mounting Dream logo) to use all 6 lag bolts. Since we used this for a 75 inch Samsung, the need for 3 studs seemed only right. However, it would be nice if the bracket were either slightly longer or had pre drilled center holes. See photos, drilled holes through the mount. After that addition, the mount took the TV like green on grass.

Was easy to install.  Clear instructions (lost of pictures) and a what to do sheet for problems.  The design error is in holes.  The two end holes are 32" center which is perfect.  They send you six lag bolts and four of them fit in the end holes. However in the center (where the other stud would obviously be) and the last bolts installed there is no hole.  So I drilled pilot holes.  They should put in a oblong center hole.  TV looks good on the wall.

This product is incredibly sturdy. No adjustments are required for mounting to the TV, as multiple screw holes are available and the wall mount itself is a fixed width to the part that attaches to the TV. My only complaint is that the screws that come with the TV were difficult to get started into the studs even with a predrilled hole, I ended up using some self-starting screws (after drilling through sheet rock) I already had on hand from another project. On smaller TVs you will need to tape the release strings to the back of the TV or to the wall, otherwise they will be visible beneath the TV. I liked the simplicity and sturdiness of this product so much that I purchased a second one for another TV I needed to mount.

Mounting was a dream! I was able to install this mount myself in less than 30 minutes. I actually used this to replace a flat mount so that I could hide my Xbox behind it (using a mount genie). It worked out and I now have a professional looking installation for less than $50. I couldn’t find any studs so I used toggle bolts and it turned out perfectly. This mount comes with an HDMI cord and 2 cord straps. It’s a great mount and worth every penny! I’m thinking of returning the full motion mount I bought from BB for the living room and ordering one from this company.

Super easy using Tapcon drill bit and 4 tapcon screws. Mounted this on a brick fireplace and hung a 65in Vizio and now a 75in Hisense. Super easy to set tv and lock it in. As with all close wall mounts, get your cords and cables on the tv before you hang on the mount. Comes with loads of hardware, can't imagine a situation where you wouldn't be covered.

It installed well and had more than adequate bolts and hardware.  There is one notable defect.  The spring loaded locking pins that are part of the arms that attach to the monitor are too long preventing them from engaging.  I have sent an email to address for support in the directions with no response.My recommendation to anyone buying this is to verify the engagement prior to mounting it on the wall.  I would have returned it if I knew it ahead of time.

This mount is sturdy and well made.  I would have no issues with buying another or recommending it to anyone.  The supplied hardware is of good quality and should mount just about any TV I can imagine.  I've read a few bad reviews of this product but most of them can be attributed to poor workmanship, not poor materials.  This mount does support 24" studs Not sure how some of the other reviews state it barely meets 16" studs.  This is mind-boggling to me.  Seriously this is a fine mount and well worth its price.

I’ve never hung a television before and figured this was the time after building a home and not wanting to pay someone to hang 4 televisions. This mount could not have been any easier. The only thing I would recommend is find out what screws to use when putting the brackets on the back of the t.v. because it comes with all different sizes.  I would highly recommend this product, amazing price too. The tilt is also easy to use.

This is comparable to the level of quality and ease of install that you could expect from a company like Monoprice except this one had free shipping and came with some extra goodies. They included a level and some other small goodies, I can't remember for sure but I think a tape measure maybe. Regardless, they gave you almost everything you would need and it went up beautifully. I was very impressed with the finish, there were no rough or sharp edges and all of the hardware was expertly machined and organized well. Very impressive quality.

I use this on my 55" Samsung and it works perfect. Only problem i will note is that the max size is for a 55" so if you plan to use it on a  55" you need to make sure you have it squared up and where you want it prior to screw it to the wall as you will have no side to side adjustment.I used lag bolts and mounted (2) 36" sections of 2x4 to the wall and then mounted the mounting plate for the tv to that. It's not likely you will have 2 studs spaced in the perfect spot to be able to mount it directly to the wall so you will need to do this if you plan on using it for a large tv.

I bought this to mount a 43" Plasma HDTV to my wall, and is the first time I have ever mounted a television to a wall.  Instructions were clear and I like the fact that the kit came all the screws necessary to complete the project.  For me, the only challenging part was getting the correct spacers and VESA screws installed.  I had some confusion with what length of screw could be installed with or without the spacers.  I ended up using the longer screw with the spacer which was the right combination.The bracket still feels solid after installation - there are no signs of bending or warping.  This bracket is a great value for cost sensitive consumers that do not want to spend upwards of $100 on a mount that your local big box store sells.  This solution gets the job done.

This is the second Mounting Dream wall mount I have purchased, with this being a larger one as I had a 55'' TV for a different room and bought this for a new 65''.These things are amazing. the instructions are easy, mounting is easy and in comes with so many different options to ensure it will work on basically any TV. The TCL I purchased has a weird bulge that made fitting this a bit awkward compared to my other TV, but the spacers made them a non issue.

This was easy to install, came with more than enough mounting option screws, washers, shims, etc. Solid, sturdy unit. Note, tilt is very limited and if you need the 24” mounting option you will need to screw the 2 pieces together, it is not one solid piece for that application.
