This really does not affect too much besides the range of motion of the clips on the rails since the mounting screws will limit their range to slide horizontally. For this to affect you though you would have to be way off on your measurements as far as how much you need to slide the TV from side to side to get it where you want it to be. But overall I am very satisfied with the purchase and the wall mount does what it is supposed to do.

I bought this because I wanted to span two studs unlike my current setup.  It does that fine.  It has all the hardware which I appreciate.  The instruction were easy to understand.  This is a tilting model.  We attached the TV with the idea that we would adjust the angle after we see what it looks like.  Probably a common thought.  We could not reach our arms (even my wife's arm) behind the TV in the limited space to tighten the hex screw that holds it in the angle you want.  Other than that it works as described.

After months and months of having this mount sitting next to my TV on the floor, it's finally up.  It goes up relatively easily if you actually read the directions fully.  My husband thought he could do it by not reading the directions.  Wrong! You really need to read the directions or you may end up with extra holes in the wall.  Like... a lot more holes.What I like about this mount is that the the TV is easily removed or adjusted.  There are little cords you pull in to lock it into place. You can adjust left and right on the Mount.  This was great for us because the studs in our wall weren't completely where they needed to be to center the TV on the wall.  We also have enough room to hide our cable box behind once it's tilted.

Works great. Holds together solidly with no play when locked in. The TV attachments came with a wide variety of spacers and adapters. Only improvement I can see is that it would be nice to have a mechanism or pin that can lock the TV in the upright position. There is a hole in the hinge that the instructions show inserting a pin in to lock it upright, but the kit did not come with a pin that fits. Easy enough fix was to just grab a scrap dowel piece, but would have been nice if the kit included a specific part to fit the hinge and lock it in place.

Does the job beautifully !I am extremely happy with this purchase. It is very easy to install, and they provide so many tools in case you don’t have them, such as a level, and 10 different screws you may need.

Good- It has pull strings to release the lower locks. That I love. My other mount requires you to get a pole and push a tab down to release the bottom.Bad- It only comes with four bolts instead of six. You'd think that if this can hold over 100 pounds they'd include six bolts to put in three studs.

Installation was pretty simple, with a lot of extra hardware included which would allow for different TV's/Applications.  The mount is well made and allows for tilt, and some side to side adjustment, so the mount allowed my TV to be centered in my space despite the location of the studs.  Basically you bolt the mount to studs in your wall, attach the bracket to the back of the TV and hang the TV onto the mount, tilt as desired, and slide side to side.  Looks and works great, reasonably low profile design.

Great simple mount for my bedroom TV.  Easy to install with few tools.My only complaint is that my TV had the largest VESA pattern(400x400) that this mount accepts, and because of that there is minimal room for left/right movement on the mount-basically the TV side and the wall side are the same size, not as it's pictured where there are inches to either side of the vertical(TV) mounts.  I wanted it centered anyway, but when trying to get the TV on the mount(without help) it was had to get it in the right spot, usually being hooked just barely on one side.

Mine was installed by the amazon pro who mounted the tv within 20 mins without any issues.The disappointing thing is that you cannot tilt in once mounted. I only learned that after he mounted it...I was counting on being able to tilt it down when I wished.

I used this to mount a Ultra-Slim Samsung 55" LED TV above a fireplace so I wanted some tilt while maintaining a low profile.  TV mounted easily and even with just under 10 degree tilt I had no issues with connections and cables behind the TV.One of the arms that mounts to the TV did not want to latch onto the frame even when pulling down the release cord.  I could get it to catch without the TV mounted, but once the TV was mounted I was no longer able to place pressure in the right location to get the catch far enough over the frame to mount.  Does not affect appearance and as one of the two are latched and I don't live in an earth quake area and too high for kids to reach it works fine, but why removed 1 star.

Hands down would buy a Mounting Dream mount again and I highly recommend it.  I've used a couple of other mounts in the past.  The monoprice mount I used in the past was good, but this Mounting Dream is even better.  It comes with all the bolts, washers, and spacers you need.  It will mount by default very close to the wall, and I wanted to leave some space to be able to plug/unplug cables so I used spaces which were fairly easy to use. You get a lot of options with the included spacers which is nice.  I haven't used the tilt for my setup, but it looks like it will work just fine and will actually hold the angle you want.  Definitely sturdy and easy to mount and remove.

It does exactly as one would expect from such a heavy-duty wall mount. The parts included are robust and they didn't leave anything out and basically give you every type of screw/fastener you could possibly need to get the job done. They make no assumptions. It was also stupidly easy to install. I have a 15 year old 40" Westinghouse LCD monitor which weighs about 85lbs and it handles it no problem. I suspect it could carry far than 200lbs if you use the beefy lag bolts (included) affixed to the wall studs. It really is a heavy-duty mount.

Very similar unit to ones I've used in the past.  This model differs in that the actual mounting arms have a better designed hinge as well as straps that hang down so you can easily pull the release should you wish to move the TV.The negative would be the convenient little level they include. I used it since it was right there but it didn't seem straight. I compared it to my own level and sure enough it was off.  The level is cheap and kind of useless, but the mount is fine.  The holes and hardware were ok. I used my own washers since they were larger but that's more of a personal preference.

I wanted to love this product. It does it’s purpose but it wasn’t awesome. You have to tighten the screws before you put it on the wall meaning you put it on the wall, figure out how you want to position it and then take it off and tighten the screws, there is no way an adult man could fit his arm on there while on the wall. The level it comes with is handy, it had all the parts and went smoother than a lot of wall mounts I have used. The ribbons to hook it on are different- I’m not sure what to do with them though as they are still hanging down and annoying.

Holds the TV perfectly. Haven't had any issues since installing it, and I'm pretty confident it will hold up. My TV is just under 50", and I did order the smaller size, and even though my TV did fit into the recommended size, it was not wide enough. I still managed to install it (cut it in half), but the second size would have probably been the correct one to choose.

This is an inexpensive mount, so I did not expect much. For the price, it is a good item. The instructions need improvement, but somehow I was able to install the TV with my husband. The tilt feature is ok, but it is fixed. It would be very hard to change once you set it to zero or eight degrees. If you are planning to change the tilt from time to time, I would recommend spending a little more and buy a better one. I just needed to install a 45" inside my bedroom and this fit the bill. I would not have chosen this for my living room.

This is a great mount. Inexpensive and easy to install. Comes with all the necessary hardware options to work with most brands and styles of TVs. I have 2 of these for different brand/size TVs and they were installed with ease. I did have a few questions so I reached out to the seller in a direct message. They went above and beyond to help me with my specific mounting questions. I highly recommend this product and the customer service goes above and beyond. If you do run into issues while using this, don’t give up, just reach out to the seller. A+ experience.

The Mounting Dream Tilt TV wall mount is a great product.  I used it to mount my 55" Samsung TV to the wall in the bedroom and am very pleased with the results.  The mounting bracket was super easy to install with a drill and socket set and the kit provides several different types of screws/spacers/washers to fit to your individual TV.  The instructions were easy to follow.  I like that the mount has an 8 degree tilt option to make the viewing angle just perfect depending on where you want to sit/lie down to see the screen.  Very sturdy, easily holds my TV in place.Highly Recommend!!
I ordered 2 of these.1 was a great experience, had no issues, highly recommended.....providing you get one that has the proper threading.

Great mounting system.  Install was a breeze and customer service from Mounting Dream is great. We had to order with them the concrete anchors and they qere sent immediatetly the same day we contacted them at no cost.Install is very easy and with the template for drilling you waste little time.

My only complaint, and this would be common across all wall mounts of this style, is that the loops on the bottom are too long when mounting a relatively small TV. I have a 40" TV mounted with this (went with this particular mount due to 24" stud spacing), and have to basically tie the dangling loops together so they aren't hanging down below the bottom of my TV.

Made of heavy duty painted steel, this wall mount is extremely strong and well made. They provide a large package of mounting screws in different lengths and gauges to attach the bracket to your TV, so you can be assured that one set will fit. They also provide a large set of different sized spacers, so you can space the bracket away from the TV (necessary for some TVs). You can also use spacers to space the TV away from the bracket to allow it to tilt down more without the bottom edge hitting the wall.It comes with heavy duty lag screws and washers, and even a torpedo level (handy) and a high-spec HDMI cable. They give you everything you need in one great package.

It took a while to figure out what spacers and screws to use but once that was done, the mount went in easily.  I bought my own lag bolts because a few reviewers mentioned bolts breaking off inside the wall, which would have been a tragedy.  If you want your TV mounted parallel to the wall, I suggest laying the TV face down on a soft rug on the floor.  Then install the wall mount connectors on the back of the TV and use a good level to adjust the degree of slant.  I had no issues with the wall portion of the mount being in two sections.  I just tightened the heck out of the eight screws that hold the two halves together.

Unbelievable that you can buy something this good for just a few bucks.  The hardest part was finding the studs.  The mount is very solid steel with a flat profile when installed.  It's literally less than 2 inches in total.  Worked great for my 65 inch TCL Roku 4k TV.  The swivel mechanism works well too.  My only fear is that someone's kid my grab the quick release straps and it falls off the wall. lol.  Don't buy a more expensive one.  This one is great, comes with all the tools including a level!

Using this currently on a 55" LG TV that was attached to a wall with studs, and have to say, it fits the need fairly well. this mounting dream installs well, with the base being anchored to the wall, the brackets screwed to the TV hung on the top, and slots for the bottom to fall into place for added security as well as better downward tilt.Installation process was a breeze. Clear directions, laid out well with black and white pictures and diagrams. One of my favorite features though was the somewhat new fad of having all of the screws/bolts/spacers/etc. in neatly labeled, sectioned off plastic partitions that corresponded with the letters called out in the directions.
TV: Samsung Electronics UN55MU6300 55-Inch 4K Ultra HD Smart LED TV (2017 Model)Compatible: YES!

Very nice mount that seems well built. It’s been holding a 55 inch Sony tv up for about two years now and I haven’t had any issues with it. The tabs that hand down work well to adjust the TV. Would be nice to have a little more adjustment on the mounting bracket itself in case you’re level is busted that way if things aren’t 100% level you can make adjustments on the fly. Note that it does have some adjustment but I can see how it may not be enough for some. Overall for the price this mount is excellent.

The level is off, don't use it.  Also don't measure your level on the center piece.  I found that mine was slightly off center, but the left and right sections where the mount goes on were.Also, the release strings are too short for my 65" Q90R, which wouldn't be a big deal of there was a ring or something to grab onto.  I put two zip ties into each side for easy grabbing if needed and taped them behind the TV so they don't hang below.

This is not ideal for over a fire place. The mounting bracket isn't wide enough to make it fully reach 24" beams on walls. If your over your fire place has 24" or more between studs, then you will have difficulty getting the bracket up. It's best if you screw a runner of 1x4 piece of board for top and bottom bolts before using this. This way your nails will have a secure base when mounting.The tilt feature is nice and being able to slide it to the left or right to center it is also helpful.

I actually purchased 3 of this up on installation  I realized the bracket was bent Plus 1 of the pins In the back was defective now the TV looks slanted Because of the wavy bracket Didn't wanna go through the hassle of on installing everything all over again to return the item so just left there alone but I was so angry because the levels would give us a good level reading but the TV was slanted until we realized by sliding the levels i say levels because we used 2 since we thought the level might be defective so by sliding the leves we realized the wall mount was  Wavy now thats the reason the TV its not properly  Level

We bought this TV wall mount bracket for our guest room after getting a 40" HD TV from a relative. We were concerned with the weight of the TV and if the bracket would be sturdy enough. After unpackaging the neatly arranged items and beginning our project, it was clear that each item was labeled to easily identify which parts were needed for our TV. After a few measurements and calculations, the TV Wall mount was installed. The TV is in a smaller room, so we liked the full tilt down so that someone can rest in the bed and easily watch TV. It is really a heavy-duty bracket that is easy to install. It sits close to the wall so you don't see the cords and back of the TV.We plan to get another wall bracket to install in our living room where there is no TV. We will hide the wall bracket with a picture. Then, when the big sports events happen at our house, we can take the picture down, easily move the guest room TV to the living room, and have a bonus room for sports!

This works perfectly for my Samsung MU6300 50” LED. Make sure you check the back of your TV for the built in holes, they need to be no more than 16” vertically and 16” horizontally. I did have to run to Lowe’s to buy bolts and nuts because I am not mounting to a wall, so wall screws that were included did not help me. I have an entertainment stand that has a plate I wanted to secure my TV to and needed this kit. The 4 bolts and nuts from Lowe’s cost me half the price I paid for this stand. It is an amazing value and sturdy and works absolutely perfectly. Do not need to spend a fortune anywhere else, order this kit, it works great!

I looked at a lot of models for the installation of a 40" TV over a fireplace mantle. I needed something with a lot of holes because I had to put the screws through mortar between the stones. I was also concerned as some of the stones stick out from the wall, but this thing was perfect! The spacers (which I think are actually to be used for the brackets to mount to the TV) were perfect for getting the right distance from the mortar on the fireplace. The hardware it came with was excellent and it even said that I could get concrete anchors by calling a number. I had some concrete anchors of my own and so I didn't call, but it's nice that's an option. Holds the TV very well and was easy enough to install.

Super easy to install. I bought and installed 2 of these in about 45 minutes. Will need a stud finder, drill/driver and a 1/2” socket. The rest of the hardware is included. *NOTE* if your TVs mounting screw holes are wider then 24” horizontally and/or 16” vertically, this mount will NOT work for you. I mounted a 55” Panasonic and a 65” Vizio with this mount.  Good quality materials, very secure. Over all this is a great mount, comes with Velcro cord ties and a very nice HDMI cable. Highly recommend this mount!

Its best laid flat. I havent been able to figure out the tilt. I will probably by one with a left right and actual updown motion if i hadnt already put it on my wall easy to come off though. 6.5 out of ten. Same rating i gave capt. America compared yo iron man 1 or avengers 1 end game is on a completely different level. Nerds may get that rating.

Very impressed with this mount!  Simple install and holds my 2012 Samsung 48” with no issues.  Tight enough to the wall and I dig those tether handles to release them if I need to take the tv down off the mount.  The kit included everything that you would need including a level and a strip of Velcro to tuck wires or tethers.  The only CON I could pick apart from this kit would be the lack of washers for thickness with the spacers.  I needed a wince more to keep the mounting rails on the tv from wiggling so I grabbed some extra washers in my shop to tighten them up.  A week ago I bought a tv from BestBuy for our living room and was contemplating a mount for our bedroom which were priced around $99.  No dice!  This is MUCH better in my opinion and for a fraction of the cost.

This is holding our 60" plasma tv very nicely. A lot of the reviews here have already covered the product itself, so I'll just share my install observations to help you have a hassle-free experience.- The low profile will make it impossible to get to any outlets in the back of the TV, so make sure to plug those in first before mounting TV.

I've mounted over a dozen wall mounted tv's in the past 10 years and this mount is the best I've ever seen. Very well built and many of the problems associated with TV wall mounting have been eliminated with this one. The instructions are clear, concise and well illustrated. It seems very strong and would probably hold much more weight that it is rated for. I love the pull tabs to lock and unlock the TV to the rails. That makes installing, uninstalling and cleaning much easier by not having to reach behind the unit with a screwdriver to loosen the screws.

Included with the easy tv mount was a large book with clear instructions and pictures. The quality of the parts are top of the line and the design makes it easy to put up or take down the tv. The new quick release brackets made it easy when we forgot to plug in the internet cable. The quality of the picture is unbelievable, makes you feel like you are right there with the people in the movie. I give this a 10 out of 10 and got here a day early. Thank you and we will tell everyone we know about this product. Oh and a really good template to work with.

Package: small and smartly boxed. So many spacers and screws and bolts to fit a wide range of installation.Assembly and installation: super easy. It took me way more to find the location of the 2x4” even though I used a stud finder. I ended up using smaller mounting screws than the ones provided, I was afraid to damage the bathroom wall on the other side.

The mount is fine, but the level that came with it is HORRIBLE. Totally messed us up while mounting our tv and we had to RE DO the entire thing after getting it all mounted because it was visibly crooked. This happened two times, on two TVs, with two of this same level. We thought it was us that messed up both times and then tried to hang a shelf with it, and the same thing happened. I compared it side by side to a different level and it had a completely different reading each time.

🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 Quality: The tv mount comes with different sized spacers in case of a curvature to the backside of the television mounted. It also comes with a magnetic level to help with the mounting process.🌟🌟🌟🌟 Practicality: The tv mount does a great job at holding your tv in place when hung on studs. The only downside is that your tv cannot be tilted or swiveled.

Bought a 55" UH7650 tv, it has a slight hump at the bottom so wasn't sure if these thin rails would work but they just clear the hump on my LG by like 1/4" or less,  so the TV will sit as close to the wall as you can get it.  This will be mounted in my room so glare isn't much of a problem so i settled for this tilt only version.  Comes with all the screws and washers for most stud like installations,  you will need to buy other screws holders for concrete walls it says.  It even comes with a level to make sure you install it leveled and HDMI cable, not sure if it's the latest type.  Pretty cool, and convenient kit though,  well thought out.

Extremely pleased. Instructions were very clear and it came with a nice assortment of parts so I had no trouble mounting the brackets to my TV. I used this with a Samsung LN52A650 TV (which is about a 52" 10 year old LCD TV that is very heavy) but it was a snap with this. I have nothing bad to say about this kit and would definitely buy another if I had another large TV to mount. When wall mounting any TV, I recommend buying some right angle HDMI adapters so you can connect the inputs. (Most point downward, but you can find some that point right or left -- I bought ones that directed the HDMI cable towards the middle of my TV.)

My LG is Vesa compatible for 600x400mm and this fit perfectly.  It's extremely low profile so when mounting on the wall with no tilt its a bit hard to see the hooks, but everything goes on well.  The TV is now on the wall and it's very sturdy.One mistake to avoid is to lengthen the straps at the bottom which unhooks the latches.  Since my TV is a 70" the straps are a bit short in it's default length so when I went to test fit the TV it latched into place and I couldn't unlatch without getting a coat hanger to pull the straps.  So before doing a test fit, make sure you lengthen the straps so it's level with the bottom of the TV before you put it on the wall.

Arguably could give five stars.  This thing is priced right, and is solid, very solid.  Easy to mount.  My only two cons for it are that the bottom clips did not easily clasp.  In fact one is still not clasped, and the other was hard to get the in.  (Sounds like poor English, but it's hard to describe.  The straps on each side pull down, allow you to clasp around a solid mount on the wall.  They would not open wide enough to get in easily.  One side finally went in, the other didn't.  It's more than solid enough, but still a pain).  I wonder if mine was just slightly out of spec, as I have not seen this comment before.  The other con was that the pull-straps hang below the TV, but I just tied them off behind it, so no biggy there.All in all, a good purchase.  I'll likely get a second one for my main TV.  (Also liked that it had a good variety of mounting hardware.  Everything I needed....)

I have mounted and hung several televisions on the wall.  I can say without a doubt that this one truly was a "Mounting Dream".  The bracket is sturdy and well made.  All of the necessary hardware including a small level and even a HDMI cable is included in package. The directions are clear and even provides a link to a YouTube video in case you are more of a visual person, like myself.This mounting kit deserves 5 stars and they sure got it from me.

This wall-mount exceeded my expectations as soon as I opened the box. I am a first time wall-mount installer and I believe that I did an amazing/professional job mounting my 40” Samsung TV onto my dry wall. The tools and instructions provided with the wall-mount made this experience very smooth.  After I decided to choose Mounting Dream over any of the Best Buy products, I realized that I saved over $300 on two wall-mounts from this company. No need to hire anyone, because everything you need comes in the box. I would recommend buying a stud finder and a drive bolt wrench that matches the measurements of the big screws. Thanks again Mounting Dream!

This is great! Mounting was OK but for some reason i could not trust the leveler... had to eyeball it to the final position... probably just a visual matter vs a leveler matter (not all walls are perfectly straight). Plan for at least 4 hours to get the mounting right... Otherwise this is a great mount and, considering what they were trying to sell me at the box-store, a great price! Seriously, don't get the ones at the box-stores... same quality at 3-4x the price.

This mount of s two pieces that bolt together in the middle. It’s about 20 inches long and not long enough to span three studs. I bought a 65 inch inch b and ended up having to mount it well off set so it would mount in two studs. It will only angle about 5-10 degrees. It’s so close to the wall you have to connect all your inputs as you can’t reach themOnce the tv is mounted. It works, it was cheap but poorly designed. I wouldn’t buy another. Now how to connect that additional HDMI....

No complaints about the build quality. It is solid.However, I suggest taking a very close look at your mounting situation before you decide which model of mount to buy. This one was a pain to install, mostly because it only mounts to the wall one way and the bracket doesn't give a lot of options either without a lot of trial and error.

This thing comes with everything you need to mount various TVs at various angles. It was very easy to set into the studs using the included bubble level. That being said, a perfectly level TV is actually driving me crazy, because I've now realized my floor is slanted. This causes the TV to look crooked above the table, even though it isn't. I'd recommend putting the level on the floor, marking the reading, then matching that reading when hanging your mount. In most cases, your floor will be level, but for older places (mine is over 100 years old), this step could save a lot of frustration. The latch holding the brackets to the frame is also a nice touch. be sure to hang your TV low enough to cover the dangling loops.

1st time hanging a TV. Ordered a fortress mount first. Complete garbage. It falls just shy of 24 inch studs.  I wondered if they'd all be like this. Tried this brand. Before putting it together I held it up to the marked studs. boom! Perfect.Assembly is very fast compared to the first one I bought. No nuts and washers to mess with. Just 4 screws and the frame is together.

Installed it myself and hung up my 50 inch fairly quickly. Was happily surprised when I noticed it came with a level, which I kept to use for a couple other projects. I was able to get 2 wall studs fairly easily, and luckily had them exactly where I wanted to center my TV. Even if I wasn't exactly able to get the studs exact, there is some room to slide the TV left or right for placement correction. Easy to take TV off of the wall mount, which I did days after installation to put a floating shelf above it. Hanging my TV freed up a huge amount of space for me to put things under it.

Easy install and secure enough for my 70 inch tv in the garage. It has a tilt function which was perfect for what I needed. Does not have a pan function but I didn't need one that did, I'd be nervous to pan a large tv.Great mount, came with a stencil, a new level, and was exactly as described. The only negative I would have (and it wasn't the fault of the manufacturer was I had to offset the mount to center my tv, it was about 4 inches short of reaching the 3rd stud.

I've had these installed for about 2.5 months now on my 65" TCL TV. They've been great. If you plan to have a lot of cables, surge protectors, or devices behind the TV, I would suggest you look for a bracket that gives you some more room between the TV and the wall.

SO HAPPY with this purchase. Really inexpensive compared to Best Buy and Target. I did see some $13 mounts at Walmart but he quality was questionable so I decided to spend a few more bucks on Amazon. I was honestly worried it’d be bad, but it’s not and I’m so glad I bought this one. The best part of this mounting set is that it comes with an extra long HDMI cable (because if you mount your TV up really high, you might need it to connect your various devices), all the mounting hardware you may need for different types of walls, AND GET THIS... a leveler!!! I didn’t even know until I opened the package and that was honestly a sweet surprise. I recently purchased a leveler because I needed it for everything I had to mount on the wall but the fact that they give you one in this set is really thoughtful! Plus you get to reuse it for the future.Love it!!!!

The hardest part was mounting the bracket to the TV. I have a Samsung 2019 QLED. It was kinda scary because the spacers I had to use for the top portion were bigger than the spacers I had to use for the bottom portion, which didn’t make the brackets perfectly flush. I had to use different sized spacers because I guess Samsung has different screw sizes from the top half to the bottom half.The washers that were provided could only fit in the small screws provided, and did not fit the large screws.

We purchased this mount for an outdoor TV. Originally we purchased a different product but I just did not seem sturdy enough. We did not fit into brick. We had to buy masonry screws instead of using what they sent. Ultimately I’m glad that we got this sturdier product than the cheaper one that we had originally looked at. my one complaint is it’s not super easy to pull the TV in and out to adjust. you have to use a little bit of strength to do so.

This product has a limited motion, but that may be a reason for the lower price, and that was good enough for me. Basically, all I needed was wall support for the tv and this product was good for that, but in addition it has an 8 degree tilting motion to help diminish glare, which I found more than appropriate (the seller advertises a similar product but with a larger range of motion)Installation is fairly easy, if you know how to use a drill and a level.  A ratchet tool is highly desirable to tighten the bolts. The set includes a little plastic torpedo type level that, while helpful, is not very accurate.  You'll be better off by using a real level.

Definitely sturdy, and definitely easy to use. And great that it covers 24”. However the only range of motion is tilting forward just slightly. Which also leaves barely any room for cording and cable management behind the tv. I have two of them and I regret both of them. It’s a hard review because the product is great if you don’t need motion or room behind the tv. If you do I recommend also getting a monitor shelf to use for any cable box or anything as there won’t be any room For anything.

The TV Wall Mount was very easy to install.  I read a lot of descriptions and reviews before deciding on this particular TV wall mount and I am very glad I decided on this one.  Once the wall bracket is mounted to the wall it was a breeze to attach the TV.  This is definitely a two person job to hang the TV.  There are two separate hangers with hooks at the top that attach to the back of the TV.  The hooks attach into the top groove on the wall bracket.  Once the hooks are in the top groove of the wall bracket, pull the bottom straps and the bottom of the hangers will click into the bottom of the wall bracket.  If you want or need to remove/take your TV down just pull both bottom straps and lift up on the TV.  Super easy.

Can't beat the bang for the buck.My only (minor) complaint is the wall bracket.  It does not have a completely flat surface to mount a level on either the top or the bottom that runs the length of the bracket.  This is due to the 2 part design of the wall mount portion.  Just made leveling a little trickier than I'd have liked.

I am glad that I bought this Wall Mount Bracket. It comes in a very neat package with wall screws to attach rectangular bracket base to the wall and many types of bolts, washers and plastic extenders to attack 2 ribs to any type of flat TV (within the size range specified in the name of this product).The only 2 additional things you will need to mount your TV are screwdriver and a drill.

Good product except very hard to level on the wall with the metal "bump" in the middle of its back preventing the placement of any straight edge across it. With the larger TVs--55, 65, 75"+--a quarter inch difference in the mounting bolts can lead to a big tilt. This product flaw led to us having to remount it after our initial try that threw our 65" TV off nearly 2" from one side to the other. Even then, we had to "guess" it by extrapolating back from how bad the lean was. Yuk.

Excellent wall mount for the price.  No difficulties with install, instruction pretty straightforward.  Comes with screws, bolts, and spacers for varying televisions.  Only drawback to this mount is that it lacks adjustable leveling screws, which you get on more expensive mounts.  This helps in ensuring that even if you are slightly off, you can still level to 0 degrees.  All in and all it’s a great mount for the price, just be aware that if you are slightly off, you will need to uses a shim to adjust to 0.

Pretty good and solid mount , however the bracket holes seem to be off a bit.My TV is a VESA 200mm configuration , the wall bracket aligned perfectly with the alcohol gauge, however after mounting the TV there was a slight 5 degree variation.Not very noticeable to return the product but still irritating when you make precise drawings and markings only to find it a bit off.

This was really the total package. It was easy to put together and comes with lots of different screw and washer options to fit all different types of configurations. I was able to make it work with my TV's really long holes without having to go to the store to buy special screws. I like the little loops on the back so you can easily latch/unlatch your TV from the mount. Plus it came with some cool accessories like an extra HDMI cable, velcro cable ties, and a handy level that is now magneted to my fridge for future use.

This is an EXCELLENT mount for the money. Really quite unbelievable. I only ended up paying $18 for it after a $3 gift card I had on my account. But still $21? You can find one less than around $50 at a store, and those are for smaller TV's. I was mounting a 55inch LG OLED TV.  Very sturdy and I had everything in the Amazon description sent to me. All the different hardware came in real handy with my install. Just do your research to be sure it fits your TV and the install really couldn't be easier. Trust me if I can do it anyone can. And all this with a nice high speed HDMI cable.

Great mount for the price. Performs as expected and secures tv well to the wall. I hung a 50’ vizio and I don’t have any real complaints besides the limited range of motion. But that’s not the product to blame cause I choose this design. There are mounts that have the ability to extend and provide more range.

I was very disappointing with this unit. The back metal plate is far too short to mount the TV'sThe TV's are in the size rating stated on the page and yet the wall plate is 1/4" too short.  Had to use plates from my old mount, but they were narrower so that is just a temporary solution.  I will use the mounts on the TV until I can justify getting  replacement set that works better. If I had a smaller TV thee would work fine.  I am using 42" TV's

This bracket comes with all the hardware necessary to mount just about any TV to the wall. The bracket itself comes in 2 pieces but screws together effortlessly. Once you have decided on heigh and measured where it is going it is easy to secure on the wall with the included lag screws. I perform a lot of commercial installs using this wall bracket and in the case of commercial offices with thin metal studs I use a high end toggle bolt which you will need to purchase separately. See the Toggler product (ASIN B0051IBBUE) for this purpose.

The mount is built well as far as I can tell, however the flaw here is in the mounting hardware for the wall bracket. For drilling into concrete it comes with some concrete anchors which are inferior to a traditional TapCon bolt and they don't work for most concrete applications where you have sheetrock over 1x2's with about 3/4 of open airspace between the sheetrock and concrete block. To make matters more difficult, the drill bit that is required so install this product on a concrete wall is probably only available in the town where it's made. 2/5" bit is what is required, if you live in America and have this bit hanging around your house, I applaud you for having definitely built schools in remote Asian villages as this is the only place I imaging you could have acquired one.The dimensions of this bracket and its holes are not perfect for hitting a stud or furring strip on both sides, and typically they're never where you need them to be anyway. Easy fix here is some 5/16"x3" Tapcon bolts, a pack of 4 is like 5 bucks. Try getting at least one side in a furring strip but if you can't, cut a small piece of sheetrock out where each hole is going to go, and epoxy a small piece of 2x4 to the concrete, then mark out your 4 holes on the small piece of wood you'd epoxied to the wall, drill through the wood with a 1/4" wood bit, and then change to a 1/4" concrete bit and finish the hole. Mount with the tapcons, and you can hang your Aunt Myrtle from this mount. The tilt feature wasn't used in my application so I can't comment on that but it looks very rudimentary.

I purchased this to mount my 55’ tv. It took me awhile to understand the directions as to which bolts/nuts go where along with which washers/screws/spacers because they give you a million options. Unfortunately that’s because there’s so many different tv options out there, not the manufacturers fault. I had to attempt several different combinations of washer/screw/spacer before I got one that I felt secured the mount well enough to my tv. My only other complaint is that this is a fixed mount which doesn’t leave a lot of room for adding additional cables to tv after it is mounted. My suggestion is to add as many cables as possible prior to mounting unless your ok pulling the tv back off the mount.

AWESOME especially for the price!!! easy to install but DO NOT USE A DRILL. you will need a SOCKET WRENCH.first, put mounting brackets on tv itself. then for the wall - use a stud finder to find wood beams. do not drill into hollow sheetrock your tv will fall. once you find studs, mark holes, use a drill bit to make holes. then when bolting in the mount, USE A SOCKET WRENCH. is easy and will get it done quickly. a drill will not work. fantastic mount

Just finished installing my 65 inch LG tv on the wall with this bad boy.  Steps were easy.  I added the spacers like it suggested for a little more room between the wall and tv.  It is a two person job and make sure to have all the suggested tools.  Finding the studs are key, so it is not coming down.  I like how the tv can move laterally on the mount, made it easier to get it centered above my fireplace.  Price was great...Best Buy would have charged me five time what this cost.

Installation was ok, but it's quite annoying that there's no fine level adjustment built into the mount.  So if you get the wall unit mounted even slightly off level, it will be very apparent on a larger tv and there's no way to adjust other than re-mount the wall unit.  A simple screw would work, like the model I bought 8 years ago?Also, plugging/unplugging HDMI cables requires removing the tv from the wall, at least on our model television.  If you plan to set it up once and forget it it might be ok, otherwise not.

The tv mount has an okay range of motion (up and down) I guess this is due to the price and type of mounting system. Overall It was so so to install we had to look up for a video to make sure it was put on correctly, it happened  to be that we had to remove a little part of washers for it to be 100% stable. (Not a big deal). It’s a good tv mount if you plan to not move the tv much to different directions (besides tilting up or down)

Works great, nice mount. Locks in place, slides left to right. Tilts forward if ya wanna hang it higher. Also comes with all the hardware and even a tool. Multiple sizes of spacers to help mount it flush to the back of the tv. Also included are instructions!! Lol sometimes rare with purchases on amazon. But for the price I’m happy it definitely serves its purpose in my den. I recommend using wall anchors for heavy TVs

Really this is a good wall mount. Construction is good, materials are heavy gauge stamped metal, and it really is easy to install. So why not 5 stars? Because the safety latches on the bottom do not engage. They simply will not go behind the rail. I'm comfortable that there is no way the TV will come off of the mount on its own, but I would have been more comfortable had the safety latches locked on to the bottom rail.

Easy to install and strong, but the mounting plate comes in two pieces which you have to attach together with 4 machine bolts. The center of mounting plate was PERFECTLY Level when I installed into wall studs, but since the two sides of the plate are separate pieces it cause my TV to sink on one side. This was a very stressful process to fix because I had to undo my hard work to fix the plate. Next time I will purchase a mounting bracket that doesn't separate the plate in two pieces.
Used to mount my new 65 inch Samsung tv. Works great.Stud finder is vital for installation.

We just hung the second of our TV's using this mounting system. Great quality, half the price of what we could get locally.  Super easy to hang the mounting bracket on the wall and the TV.  We've recently got rid of cable and are strictly going with HD Antenna and Hulu/Roku.  Throughout the progression, we've had to take the TV off the wall a couple of times and it's so easy with this system. There's a distinctive click when it locks into place so no worries on whether or not it's on secure.

I was a cook in the Navy for 20 years because of my mechanical ability.  When I worked in Audio Video sales I was a very good sales person, but would not attempt to install anything.  Well, I bought two of these mounts and managed to mount 2 lcds, a 43" Sharp and a 55" Lg OLED.  These wall mounts were a breeze to put together and the brackets that went on the tv's were simple with a wide variety of bolts, washers and spacers to accommodate all of your needs. Wish I were an electrician and I could move the outlet up the wall behind the tv's so the power cords weren't hanging down the walls.

The base is good overall. I was disappointed woth the tilting option as not being something you can go to and from. Looks like you have to remove the tv and use the L key provided to move the support system and adjust it so the tv tilts. It’s not as easy, will require two people each time and can be a spin in the behind. Other than that, it’s great if you’ll have it in a fixed position, be it tilted or straight.

This was one of the best installations and assemblies my husband and I have ever done. The instructions were really well written and all the hardware came presorted in its own plastic bag with the corresponding letter. The level it came with was magnetic which made installation even easier. This mount was a fantastic purchase for our TV. The included HDMI cable was a nice touch too. The mount looks and feels very sturdy and I am sure it will last a long time. If you are looking for a nice basic mount, go with this one.

I have extra thick insulation so, I used 5 inch carriage bolt screws (instead of those included), to secure these into 2x4 studs. Otherwise, it was fairly straightforward. It seems sturdy, and the wall bracket can be tilted down for better viewing.

Holds up to its promise! Don’t let the directions and all the extra hardware/screws throw you off, it’s really easy! It only took us about 45 minutes to install, and would’ve been quicker but there were no studs in my wall, so had to get out the drill bits and use six dry wall anchors (always keep a pack of these things handy). Another cool thing, After we install the TV itsat about 1ft too high for me. We easily were able to remove the tv and adjust the wall bracket, lowering to desired height. Great purchase! Would buy again.

my goal in buying this was to install a smaller 27" tv in my guest bedroom and its doing just that after a quick installation! I like that it came with a small level to make sure the brackets were level. Great product, great price. No complaints here!

We bought this to install our new Samsung 65" TV on wall studs. Make sure you install it only on studs or else you may cause damage to your wall. I installed free Stud finder application on my samsung phone and it worked great.Material looks good & it can be tilted little bit. I used brackets at the back to adjust the viewing angle so it looks perfect. I just wish there was some more space at the back so i can adjust the cables and add/remove devices whenever i need to.

I got this bracket for a 52-inch television, which is the maximum size recommended for this bracket.  The bracket feels a bit lightweight for that size of a television, but it is holding it up.  Pros:  It's the only bracket I could find that has the two critical features I had to have for the spot I was putting it, namely (1) a hole in the center (because I have a wall socket sticking out from the wall there) and (2) screw holes in the middle, top and bottom (because I have a stud running down the middle of the fireplace, and the next studs to either side are 22 inches away).  I was able to mount this bracket by bolting it to the stud in the middle, top and bottom, and then balancing it to prevent tilting using toggle bolts through the drywall on the left and right sides.  Cons:  After mounting, there is very little space behind the television to work with.  I can't see back there, and I can't reach back there.  I got the TV plugged into the wall before mounting it, but nothing else is going to fit.  Fortunately, I shouldn't need more than just the power connection and one HDMI cable, but it's pretty limiting not to be able to work behind the television.

The instructions were great, and clear.  The mounting brackets were easy to install, spacers included, made it simple to angle tv .Once the mounting bracket was on the wall, it was easy to clip the TV onto the wall bracket.  Everything took less than an hour, including vacuuming the dust from drilling the wall.

If you want to catch studs [you should] and you have any outlets on that wall, the hardest thing about this narrow [widthwise] mount is making sure they'll be no interference.Took me 15 minutes to triple check everything [up/down, left/right] before drilling the holes into the studs.  [Don't expect the mount to be centered to the TV ... mine was shifted 6" off-center.]

Almost bought one for 4x more at Costco but decided to give this mount a try before using it for my other TVs.  The packaging was good and even came with a leveler to help with the install.  Mount works perfectly and I have no issues.  I ended up ordering three more of these and all were good except one had missing hardware but what do I expect at the price.

I have some experience in construction and was able to just mount the tv with drywall screws. I have a 55 in flat screen, I haven't had any problems since, and it is really secure.I did have shipping trouble and had to wait a little while longer than usual. But nothing to really complain about.

I have to give this product 5 stars.  The unit is very inexpensive, easy to install and is attached to the wall with lag bolts that could hold up my sofa so I certainly don't worry about the tv.  At first I was worried because one of the few pre-assembled parts was done incorrectly and while I could repair it by drilling out two rivets and replacing them with a bolt  I was reluctant to do that.  I called their number and got a busy signal and figured service would be a problem.  They called back within 5 minutes (without my leaving a message) and had the replacement parts shipped to me in under 48 hours.  Companies will have occasional shortcomings but when they promptly resolve an issue completely that promptly they deserve a compliment and I offer them one with this review.

I've installed several mounts like this before and can say this one is just ok.  It could be the issues I have with it are because of my particular tv but it seems like others would have the same issue.  I bought a 43" TCL Roku TV from Costco.  The vesa mounts are lower on the back of the tv which causes the release straps to hang way below the bottom of the tv.  There is no recommended solution for what to do with them if this is the case.  So I suppose I will have to tape them to the bottom of the tv to hide them away.  Also, I agree that the tilt cannot be set after mounting.  The adjustment screws are impossible to reach once the tv is mounted because the wall is in the way.  The instruction manual diagram for this makes it look like the wall isn't even there to be able to adjust the screws.  The best you can do is leave them slightly loose so you can tilt the tv once mounted but then it has to be the full 10 degrees.

I purchased this wall mount for a 50" Insignia Roku TV for our guest bedroom.  The mount is very light weight and was easy to assemble.  All of the required hardware was included.  The product did include a small level but I used a much larger level for the install.  Once the bracket was secured to the wall using the supplied lag bolts, hanging the TV was a breeze.  I did a gustimate on angling the TV down before I hung it which ended up being perfect.  The TV "snaps" onto the wall bracket but still allows you lateral movement to fine tune your placement.  Overall a great product at a great price!
Day 1 after installing the mount.Vizio 65” M series.

Very easy to install and very well priced. I feel like this is a great product to secure your TV but it doesn't have a lot of range of motion. We didn't quite look for that though, we just wanted to mount the TV away from our upcoming baby

I mounted my 60" Sharp Aquos HD 3D TV on this without any issue. I particularly love the pull straps to unhinge it from the wall when you want to take it down to paint or otherwise. The level is a nice touch but ultimately not needed as I already have a few of them. But is definitely worth it to the majority who do not. But then again, if you do not have a small level but have drill bits, drill and sockets to drive it to mount yourself. Then WHY????

Wall mount is super easy to install. Plenty of flexibility for TV placement no matter where your wall studs line up. I installed mine flat, but the frame offers a simple and effective tilt ability. The weight-baring “hooks” seem a little chintzy considering they’re holding up your beautiful new TV, but I felt the same way about the $100 wall mount I helped my father-in-law install for his massive 80”. Just make sure you check the weight of your TV and max load of the mount. Very pleased with this mount especially for the price.

Used this to install a 43-inch LCD tv to a wall. Took about 45 minutes. Installed into studs. The spring-loaded attachment clips did have these leashes hanging from them that fell below the bottom of the tv, leaving them visible. I just bundled them up a little higher with some blue tape. I later found two velcro straps that I think came from the box that should also do the trick to hide the dangling leashes.

Really surprised by the quality of this thing for the price. Comes with literally everything you would need and even a scenario/solution troubleshooting pamphlet. I was worried about how solid it was would be screwed together but its rock solid.One thing that you need to be aware of before marking all your holes, is that the top and bottom mounting channels do not line up perfectly. Mounting on studs this is extremely important, as the top one could line up but the bottom one might not. Wide enough to find a spot where both line up, but if the top lag bolts fit, make sure the bottom ones are still in the stud.
Wanted a cheap mount for a secondary TV. Should have spent more.Sketchy build quality for 3 reasons:

I was skeptical, but like you, I scoured the reviews and decided to go for it. It was easy to install and is designed very well. Once the mount is up on the wall and on your tv, it’s very easy to attach the two. There is a good bit of room to slide the tv to really fine tune the placement. The tv is very secure and it looks awesome! We took it a step further and got a kit to run all the cords behind the wall for a really nice and clean look. I’m so thrilled with this affordable product!

I love buying these mounts cuz they have many options for drilling holes and sit pretty flush. As a TV Technician myself, I highly recommend flush mounts/low pro mounts in general over full motion mounts. Specifically any tv over 70” and above. Remember, it’s not the same holding 75 pounds close to your chest, than holding it away from you. The tension is much greater the further away from the wall.

This sturdy steel mounting bracket came packaged with everything I needed to get my 43" LG LCD on the wall securely (including a small torpedo level). It was easy to mount the wall bracket (my wall studs were 16" on center) , attach the mounting bracket to the back of the TV (VESA 200 x 200), and hang the TV on the wall bracket. The unit has two spring-loaded locks which engage & disengage with two pull-down straps, making it easy to remove the TV from the bracket if necessary to plug or unplug cables. I had a few plastic spacers left over (various sizes are included for different TV's). The instructions were clear, and I had the project done in 20 minutes.

It says to use these on wood studs or concrete.My TV ain't that heavy and it's out of the way, so I used this just fine on metal studs. I just had to use different screws since the ones that cane with it wer a bit too beastly for my purposes.. But I guess I'm using this outside of its intended use.

This wall mount met all our expectations at a great price.  It was easy to install and everything worked great.  The only recommendation I would make is that it would be nice if there was a bolt hole in the center of the wall bracket.  The instructions say to use all 6 lag bolts if you are mounting at 32" but there are no holes predrilled for attaching to the stud in the center.  Other than that this is a great wall mount for the price.

It is a solid TV mount that was easy to install. It comes with everything you need to make sure your TV will fit and everything you need to install including a mini level! My only drawback to this was that although I installed my TV mount straight, the border around my door that sits next to the TV isn't level so the TV looked crooked even though it wasn't. My issue with the product is that I wish there was a way to adjust the crookedness after you have installed and put the TV up on the brackets. I have another TV wall mount with small screws that you can adjust with an allen key to fix the side tilt. The solution with this product was the adjust the brackets on the back part of the TV but apparently my door frame was even more crooked than that so I needed a slight bit more of an adjustment. Outside of that, great product.

Super easy to install, very customizable for different tvs, also loved how it came with different solutions for unusual framings as well (we used solution 2 with some extra wood to mount it) also tilts very well and holds steady to the wall!

The product was very sturdy, well made, and the instructions clear. This made placing the mount on the wall above my fireplace easy. Attaching the portion of the mount to the TV was also very easy and straightforward. The most tedious part was lifting my 65 inch flat screen TV up to the wall to attach it to the mount. I had help with that. Everything else concerning this item was exactly as I expected it would be. I recommend it for consideration.

I've recently developed an obsession with mounting TVs, and have tried dozens of brands and styles. This mount is perfect if you're looking for something slim, but sturdy. It's currently holding an old 48" LG LCD in the bedroom that's thick by itself, and I didn't want any additional depth to having it sticking off the wall.The hardware provided for mounting to the wall, and the arms to the TV are a good quality, and the quick release arms made it easy to pop the TV on and off the wall quickly as I continuously forgot to attach cables. Speaking of cables, the included HDMI cable was surprisingly higher quality than I expected, and hasn't caused any issues running the signal from my PS3 to the TV so far.

I had to wait to get the tv mount on the wall because my tv is old and very heavy. My brother mounted it on the wall but it does not fit the tv. I am being told older flat screen tv's did not have the standard bracket length they do now. now i can't return it because it had a limited return window. never do this again I will pay attention to an item with limited return. expired on 8/23 and today is 8/25

Purchased this to hang a 55" insignia fire tv.  Went up perfectly.  We were able to use the wall studs to hang it.  My only complaint is that when it shipped it was WAS not in a separate shipping box.  It was a little beat up when it came. Otherwise, it hold my TV in place beautifully.  I like that it has the option to pull the toggles loose that lock the tv in place and install cables or change cables.

Ordered this for a 55" Samsung.  Easy to fit and hang.  Very pleased with purchase.  This comes with just about anything you will need in hardware, except anchors for block/concrete walls--which we needed.  We used (2) lags from previous TV mount and (2) large tapcons and it is a very strong fit.  It even comes with a little torpedo level, but we opted to use a 2' level.  This has to be the easiest on/off mounting system ever.  Will be ordering another for another room.

Easy installation I must say.  Mounted a 47 inch Samsung with ease.  The most time consuming part was locating the wall studs.  I much prefer a magnetic stud finder over an electronic.  The electronic stud finder, mine at least, wasn't accurate (edge-to-edge).  The magnetic stud finder, which you can find for around $10 at HD or Lowes, was incredibly accurate.Socket wrench for the lag bolts also made things easier.  Only recommendation:  make the HDMI cable solid black.  The blue coloring makes the cable less inconspicuous.  We plan on mounting another TV in the future and I'll be purchasing again for sure.

This is easy to install and securely holds a 50" flat screen tv. I only take away one star because once the tv is in place, it isn't easy to adjust the angle or to reach video inputs on the back of the set. The second issue is more due to the set's design because I have another Smart TV that has inputs on the side rather than the back so this mount wouldn't be a problem for newer sets. As it is, I just had to purchase an inexpensive adapter to use my Amazon firestick with this mount and it works perfectly well after a struggle to blindly feel for the input port. Not a deal breaker. This is a solid product.

This wall mount is excellent.  I currently have three tvs mounted on the wall.  All are very good.  This mount is excellent.  It came with all the different mounting screws, washers and spacers that could be needed.  The price is 1/4 of that of the one I'd have had to buy from BJ'S.  The mount is very heavy duty.  Excellent!The only negative I have is, the supplied level.  The level I got was in accurate.  ( Note my son had the same problem with another company's supplied level.  This one was affixed permanently on the tv mount.)

This kit came with everything you need. Handy templates and levelers as well. Very low profile so make sure you got plugged in what you need before hanging up TV. Was easy to install, and instructions were clear.Only flip side to this review would be that the suggested height of the center of TV might not have taken size of TV into account. I did a search after i hung it and felt it might have been too low (aesthetically) and found other sites saying to hang higher. When sitting on the couch however, it does look perfect with no strain on the neck. Just keep in mind before mounting "permanently".

The He's a for my tv was too large for this, make sure you check yours!!! However, I contacted customer service to see if I could just buy the bracket instead of the entire set and they helped me every step of the way. They were so kind and prompt. I was absolutely astounded at how wonderful and helpful they were. The bracket is awesome! Very sleek, easy to install and easy to get the tv down if you need to. I definitely recommend this to anyone looking to mount their tv. It is better prices than anything I was seen in the store and the quality is outstanding.

I’ve ordered this TV mount before and had no issues. This time was a completely different story.It took me three attempts to get this TV mounted level. I could not figure out why after mounting the TV a second time it was still crooked. On my second attempt I disassembled and assemble the bracket itself thinking it was crooked (it comes in two prices that you have to put together). After putting the TV back up it was worse then my first attempt.

It's ok. I believe the bubble leveler was off that was provided to me. It didn't level correctly. I went base off of that, and the TV came out crooked when finished mounting. When I re-leveled using the provided bubble level on the mounted TV, it showed the bubble dead centered. When I used the "real" bubble leveler (my personal one), it showed the bubble was a bit off centered.Had to improvise and stick a wooded skewer where the hook hangs.

I have a small apartment and two crazy toddlers so being able to put my TV out of their reach saves me space and money so I don't have to replace it after they draw on it.I wasn't able to put it on studs so I did some research and decided to buy a snap drywall toggle and haven't had any issues with it. I used a plastic sleeve to fix up the cords and make it look nice.

I thought I was buying the fully articulated mount, which I've installed before and was excellent, but when I opened the box realized my mistake.  No biggie, don't really need the full articulation where I was putting the tv I thought.  I was wrong.  This one has a very limited range of motion and the tv doesn't really fit tight on the mount--seems a bit suspect when you need to adjust the angle, and I don't have a lot of trust that it'll stay on the wall if someone bumps it in just the wrong way.  Strongly recommend spending the $12 extra or whatever it is to buy the fully articulating one, because it is truly fantastic.

Opened box to find Lag Bolts out of their packaging and falling out of manufacturers box into Amazon’s. Then the plastic divided packaging w all appropriate brand bolts has been torn open (all M6 bolts removed & then apparently returned)  which is of course the size we need to mount brackets to our TV.  Instead of the bolts the torn open empty plastic was left in the package for us. Yet stickered “inspected”??  No tv mounting happening w this purchase. Disappointing because these are well made mounts we’ve purchased many times over the years

Simple system to use - you should be able to find studs on 16" centers so all four lags are into the wood for great strength. The TV will slide on the rail to center where you want. Otherwise 2 of the screws may need a wall anchor. The screws provided didn't fit my older Seiki TV but I had some already. If you don't need the TV to turn left or right this should be fine. I would recommend.

I was at first unsure of this product as I had never mounted a TV to the wall before. However it was truly easy to install. The instructions were clear once you figured out the bolts for the TV. Once up it has not had an issue in six months and seems to be well attached to the wall without issues.Only downside I found was that the little screw to lock the mounting arms after attaching the TV to the bracket is a bit had to reach particularly if it is near another wall. I just took it down and tightened it before rehanging the TV.

Instructions were made by a five year old! Honestly I had to google the proper way to install because the instructions given were lacking so much information. It is not made for a 65’ tv!! There was zero to minimal tilt! Horrible mounting. Also, it was so close to the wall I couldn’t even plug up any of my devices! Waste of money!!

I was pretty skeptical at first because of how cheap it was and how the metal on the arms felt. I kept thinking “I’m sending this back probably”.  Was pleasantly surprised.  Very easy to install and the arms snapped right into place with no issues.  We had a Sanus brand tv mount that came with our house and had nothing but issues.  This has been great so far.

we used this to mount a TV in our church above the pulpit. went to tilt the tv and one of the brackets popped loose from the bottom where the pull string is located (and no, the pull string did not get caught on any thing). i dropped every thing in my hand to catch that end of the tv until some ran up to help me. quick thinking saved my life because the tv is mounted 7 ft high!

The hardest part of installing this TV mount was determining how high above the cabinet to place it.  This mount is sturdy, and comes with a variety of hardware (not all TVs need same size screws / bolts).  It was easy to install, and mount the TV.  The mount is versatile so that you can mount into wall studs, and I highly recommend you use a stud finder just for that purpose.  I would not recommend drywall anchors, as some reviewers claim.  Why take a chance with your valuable TV.

This is an excellent product and it is easy to put it together. Instructions are pretty clear and all the pieces come organized, separated per letters according to the instructions. Highly recommend it.

I bought this for my parents for a 58" tv. I have bought other mounts for my tvs...some of around the same price and some expensive.  I loved this mount. Very easy to assemble. It had different size screws to assure the right size of your tv was included, and it also had two lengths of each in case you wanted to add some space tp the wall with the spacers that were also included.  One review mentioned plastic parts...this is not an issue. Highly recommend.

This item was easy simple and very strong. A very well built unit, safe, I'm sorry there is no picture now but to tell you this in 3rd grade way...I'm satisfy with the price and material thanks again and keep up the good job.

I ordered two of these. It took my son and I less than 20 mins to install each one. It comes with a mini level, all you need is a good drill and stud finder. I usually look up whatever model info on YouTube to find a good diy video to assist me. I found a gentleman that told you what to do first for this mount, his instructions were on point.

Bought this to hang a Sony 55” TV in the bedroom.  I really didn’t need any tilt, just basically flat on the wall.  Very easy to assemble and install.  The hardest part is finding studs and making sure everything is centered and level.  I used my own 36” level but I think the one it came with would’ve worked fine too.Overall, it’s sturdy, easy to detach from the mount and works great for my purposes.  Great buy.

The maximum your wall studs can be are 16" on center, which is the standard for most construction. But if your studs are off by one inch you are out of luck. You either put 2X4s across your studs or order the extension, the extension would great if you have studs on 24" centers. ****If the mount were made 2 to 3" wider that would give you the room for some error on your stud placement.**** If that were the case it would be a great mount for the price. Also they don't warn you in the description not fitting exactly 16" centers.
It doesn't fit my television

I tried a number of mounts, before settling on this one. It is very close to the wall, which makes wiring a trick; it also makes it hard to get my hands behind it to pull down on the string latches. The good news is it is very slim, close to the wall and leaves little doubt that my TV will be damaged in an earthquake (we're in CA). This mount is also very simple, easy to put together and install. Very satisfied.

You cannot beat these TV mounts - not joking! I’ve gotten three now and they were super easy to install and hold great! They provide you with everything you need to install (except a drill). Used this for my 65” curved Samsung TV. Once you find the studs in the wall, you just screw the mount to the wall and lift the TV onto the wall mount. Super easy. Highly recommend this company/product!

The bars that go on the TV have evenly spaced holes to allow for different VESA sizes. However, the hole that worked for my TV was right above the piece that goes on the mount. Since the hole was so close to that piece, there was no room to place a washer. I didn’t the washer was that essential, so I decided I’d just install it without one. However, it is definitely a design flaw.

The level included with the kit was totally inaccurate. Unfortunately we did not realize that until we had installed the entire system and put huge holes in our wall that were not in the right place. We had to uninstall completely and redo everything using our own level. Once it was properly level, installation was simple and though it does not allow for any tilting, we are pleased with how secure everything seems to be.

Easy to mount, light enough for one person to hold while the other person marks off where to drill the holes. The level is a little slow with the bubble not floating immediately but it worked overall. Nice mount. I wish all TV mounts came with tethers on the release pulls. I have a 70 inch TV and the mount did not have them and it was a royal pain to get your arms underneath to find the release pull. Thanks for adding the tethers on the release pull!  someone used their heads :-)

TV mount is surprisingly sturdy and well equipped. It comes with a plethora of mounting hardware to choose from - use what ever works for your situation. The lag screws work well and appear to be sturdy. Nice to have a level included and I'm not mad at an extra HDMI cable, although I didnt use it.Currently have a 42" Vizio mounted to this, but no doubts that it will hold up a much lager television and I plan to keep this mount for my next upgrade.

There's not much to say, it works exactly as it's supposed to. Got it mounted up in about 10 minutes thanks to having the studs marked already. Do yourself a favor and download a digital bubble level app on your smartphone though instead of using the included level. It's not very accurate. But then again, I didn't buy this for the level or included HDMI cable. Also look into HDMI switches, because it is a pain to pull the TV down just to plug something in.

After putting up the wall bracket completely level, the TV sat approximately 1/2in out of level. I had to remove 3 out of 4 screws from the wall and adjust the bracket to make it 1/2in out of level as well and then the tv sat level on the wall. I don’t know if the brackets on the TV weren’t made properly or if the mounting holes in the TV weren’t drilled properly but I had one hell of a time getting this bracket up properly and have several extra holes in my daughters wall that didn’t need to be there.

I purchased this mount for a 46" Samsung knowing that I only needed a slight tilt while wanting it close to the wall. The frame is very slim, allowing for the short depth from the wall. The TV brackets were average depth. They have a simple swing arm on the TV brackets allowing for the tilt with an adjustable screw to lock them in place.Installation was very simple. Start to finish was maybe 15 min once I read through the simple instructions.

super easy to install. Comes with everything I needed and then some. It came with several different diameter and length bolts and a good combination of spacers (if needed) It even comes with a small level, and nice cable ties. Only tools I needed was a drill with bit and a screwdriver. The tv can be slid left or right on the mount, to help center it better on the wall.The downside is there is no way to lock it into that position. So it can be moved easily by anyone that can reach it. No worry about it falling off tho because there are hard stops on either end of mount.

Works great purchased so the tv would be close to the wall. I wasnt thinking about the added depth of a board for it to mount securely.  I had to add a board because my wall studs were not in a great spot, the mount now sticks out further than I really wanted. Just something to keep in mind. The tv mount is perfect, if only the spot I wanted it hang were too.

This product has held up over the course of 6 months. I was a little nervous buying a cheap mount, but once I got the product the metal seemed to be of sturdy quality.The instructions were simple, I highly recommend a stud finder and make sure you have a drill bit. Once installed I gave it a couple strong tugs and it didn't budge. It might sound counter intuitive, but make sure you do this when you mount yours. You want to make sure the screws are in the right place in your wall and can carry the weight.

This is an effective mount that is very cost effective. It's easy to put together and only requires 4 screws into the wall. I love the little extras. The level is great and the HDMI cable has a very strong cord and just what I needed. You can tilt this but we had no need to tilt it. The only thing is that the straps hang down and you'll see it behind the TV. Not a big deal to us but if it is to you, just something to consider. Otherwise, it does exactly what it's supposed to and got our 60" up with no issues.

There is nothing fancy about this mount.  It does the job as it should.  Its no nonsense and decently easy to install.  I would recommend throwing out the level included and use one you get from the hardware store.  Mine showed level according to the included level.  Once I got the television up, i can see its not actually level.  So I remounted everything, and all is well.  But comparing my level with the included one, I can see the included one is crap.Dont spend more on a wall mount.  All of the same types of mounts do the same thing.  And this one does the job just fine.

This is actually the 7th TV mounting bracket set I have used.  After the first one which I used at my daughters house and then I moved which meant that I to hang three more TV's.  Then my other daughters condo and finally a friend. I cannot say enough about how great there TV mounts are.  They are sturdy, well made, they give you absolutely everything you need to mount them............even down to a bubble level !  I couldn't recommended it more highly.

For a low cost mount, this is a really professional and easy to install mount. It comes well packaged with a whole range of bolt and spacers, for any possible TV size, and even includes a level to make sure you mount it straight. Clear instructions and nice extras like a HDMI cable and a pre-cut template so you can easily mark and drill holes.I'm super impressed.

Installed a 55" tv myself with this mount. Was easy to mount. But this has some flaws, its not easy to assemble the backplate, the screws are too small and the holes too tight. But in the end it all worked out. Pretty sturdy when assembled, tv looks awesome on the wall. Everyone happy with the installation. Was my first tv mounting took me total of 90 mins including all drilling etc.

I purchased this a while ago and waited to see how it would hold up. So far so good. i have a 75 inch mounted above a fireplace with a tilted view and i have had no issues with it so far. i used my own level since it is longer than the one provided. I had it up an running in about an hr which included hanging the TV to the mount, relocating the wires etc. Im pretty handy with tools so it wasn't rocket science for me at least.Good product, value.

My TV is about 105lbs and after 1 month it is thankfully still hanging. I didn't have a lot of confidence that it would hold such a big TV and the center of the mount is ever so slightly pulled away from the wall but it's holding up. I would have a bit more peace of mind if there was a center hold directly above the middle bracket so it would attach to 3 studs instead of 2. Instead, the middle bracket blocks the middle stud. As long as it holds the TV on the wall, I'm happy.

Very nice kit - well packed, good instructions, easy to assemble, came with multiple hardware/spacers to fit range of TV models. Even came with HDMI cable and handy level gage to aid install. Installing wall mount was fairly easy, degree of difficulty mostly depends on walk construction. Hanging TV on wall mount was easy. Would suggest purchasing a cord conceal kit to hid cables.

I love that it is sturdy and well made. It came with instruction, and it was easy to follow through the instructions. The price for this is another pro.It came with universal spacers, bolts, and washers that helped to see how far I wanted the tv to stick out from the bracket. It also came with a link of how to mount the tv.

This is a very sturdy and stable product.  I hung a Samsung 65” 7300 curve with it so in my case you have to use the thin spacers to correctly attach the brackets for the TV side effects o get around the curve.  Nobody tells you this, but it’s important.  Also measurements on placement on the wall are not overly hard, but measure twice and drill once, particularly if you are over a fireplace mantle.  Get the position on the wall high enough so the bottom of the TV doesn’t hit the mantle. Other than that you’re good.  The product is a steal at this price.

Price, simplicity and sureness of latching make this a dream. It constructs to 24” wide with 4 small bolts, guides you to use the right bits and when it snaps into place with the spring-closed latches you know it is secure.
